1st Edition

Rumbling of Heaven and Earth

Prologue

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|

Immediately upon his defeat by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| ordered Mai, who had been on standby in case of emergency, to return to their safe base, the Heavenly Star Palace.

Without even changing out of his blood-stained robe, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| screamed out loud as his face contorted in humiliation.

“Damn {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, quit messing around!! What kind of a hero are you when you couldn’t even protect Veldanava-sama!!”

These were the true feelings of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was furious from the bottom of his heart.

He had known that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was strong, but he never thought he could be defeated while in possession of the ‘Castle Guard.’

That’s right, the breach of the invincible ‘Castle Guard’ had been too unexpected even for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Even if he had not been of a cautious disposition, this would still be reason enough to choose to withdraw. That’s why this was not something to be ashamed of—{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| understood this, but he was still unable to control the anger welling up inside him.

Although abhorrent, it’s not as if it was a decisive defeat. By telling himself this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| tried to regain his composure. Specifically, he temporarily ignored his own defeat and turned his attention to the war situation with the others. As a result, he was shocked by an unexpected turn of events.

‹{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama, have you finished with {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|?›

{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was their biggest concern. So {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sent a ‘thought’ to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| directly, but there was no response.

…? What’s going on?

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were one and the same, sharing the same power. No matter how far apart they were, even if they existed in different dimensions, their shared will would never be severed.

The only case where this would be possible was if one of them was in a critical situation where the other was unable to respond… Still, unlike {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a ‘Parallel Existence,’ so as long as a copy of himself remained, he could revive in any situation.

Therefore, there should be no reason to panic.

No—while there should be no reason to panic, the lack of response was still unusual.

Since the stopped time has been released, the battle should have been won by now…

{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| should not even be aware of the Suspended World. In other words, the plan should have been accomplished as soon as Leon was lured to the bait.

And yet…

A bad premonition was making {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s heart pound.

And then, the message was delivered.

«Ah…my wish has been granted. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, my only regret is leaving you behind…»

This was the ‘thought’ that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was on the verge of disappearing, sent to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with the last of his strength.

He could feel {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s power inside him.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘will ’ was no longer there.

This was confirmation of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s “death.”

“It can’t be…{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama is a ‘Parallel Existence,’ right? Whatever the situation, as long as I’m safe, it should be possible to revive him…”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was so distraught that he was unable to even try to mend the situation.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the first friend he had made.

Unlike Zalario and Fenn, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the first friend he had ever allowed himself to be open and honest with.

The cautious {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had always prioritized {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s security, taking a multitude of precautions until he felt absolutely sure that things were safe.

And yet, there was no sign of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| reviving.

No, the Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ itself had not disappeared, and there was a sign that the Manas had come back.

It would respond to questions, but there was no longer an ego.

It was merely the power to control ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ in its pure form.

It was a fundamentally different existence from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s friend who wished to revive Veldanava of his own free will.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no choice but to admit that his friend had completely disappeared.

“Why…how did this happen?” He asked these questions without thinking, but no one could answer them.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was left stunned by this unbelievable event.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s last words reverberated in his mind.

What did he mean by “his wish had been granted?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could not understand it at all, but he felt a little better knowing that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s death was not in pain and that his life had had meaning.

However, he could not help but feel jealous of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

How sly, to be satisfied with yourself and leave me behind, he thought to himself.

………

……

…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was lonely.

As the head of the Seven {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Angels, he was the leader of the group, and all the responsibilities fell upon his shoulders. All decisions were left to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s will, without the possibility of consulting others.

When Veldanava left, there was no way to escape the pressure.

To everyone’s dismay, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| remained at the forefront as a leader.

It was inevitable that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who made all decisions on his own, would be out of step with his colleagues. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s fault was that he did not care about what his colleagues thought. The accumulation of such a situation led to discord, and without {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| realizing it, he gradually lost grip of the group. As a result, the group lost their cohesiveness.

Whether it was fortunate or unfortunate, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was unaware of this reality…

Fenn was also his friend, but he did not trust him enough to show his weakness. After all, there was no one, not even one person in the whole wide world, who could understand {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and heal his heart.

Then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| appeared.

As a comrade with the same goal in mind, and as a friend who could understand the other, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| fulfilled that empty part of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

It was a joy he had never experienced before.

Before long, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had become as important to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as Veldanava.

However, reality was cruel.

The friend he had finally made disappeared, leaving {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| behind.

‘What do I…?’ —For the first time in his life, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| felt weak.

………

……

…

“Hey, General, quit your sulking and tell me what to do next.”

Though it was only for the blink of an eye, it’s true that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was stunned. However, it was Vega, who was well known for his lack of discretion, who called out to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| without consideration.

There was another person there, Mai Furuki, but she remained silent as usual and kept a quiet eye on the situation.

Vega was the only one who seemed indifferent.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was offended and looked at Vega.

“Shut up. We just lost contact with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama. You must understand that this is not the time for you,” he spat out at Vega in a bid to silence him.

However, Vega did not read the air.

“Hah? After all his bravado, that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| guy still lost. How pathetic.” And so on and so forth, he continued to speak.

It was enough reason for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to become furious.

“I am telling you to shut up!” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| shouted, and then he launched an aggressive and vicious attack on Vega.

“Ggh, this guy is amazing…”

The difference was like heaven and earth.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Vega were so far apart in strength that there was no way to bridge the gap. However, even after realizing this, Vega did not shut up.

“Hey, hey, are you saying I’m wrong? {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lost because he was weak. This is a world where might makes right, so there’s no justice or crap if you die! Am I right?”

His words may have sounded like an incitement, but this was merely Vega’s true feelings and principle of action.

In a sense, it was a good argument and a truth.

However, even so…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could not nod his head in agreement.

“Don’t you dare talk about {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama like that!!”

He tried to silence Vega by punching him, as if to counteract those words.

But Vega still did not shut up.

“What the hell are you talking about?! Look, you didn’t give a shit when that bastard {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| died, and you didn’t even care when I ate Oria and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, right? Come on, that’s because you thought I was right, isn’t it? Am I wrong?”

He was right.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had not been saddened by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s death. More than that, he had been displeased with the failure of the mission and was busy thinking of the next best course of action.

This was the same attitude he had toward his old colleagues. Oria and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who he considered as nothing more than pawns, were nothing more than insignificant beings. When he learned that Vega had eaten them, all he felt was a mechanical impression that it was not a waste if it had led to Vega’s growth. Therefore, he had not blamed Vega, and in fact, he even thought that it served to strengthen their military force.

“Tch, impudent loudmouth…”

“Heh, that’s just my nature.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was slightly upset that his feelings had been detected. He further intensified his pressure on Vega so that he would not be aware of it.

“What would you know? I pursue a higher purpose, and in order to achieve it, I will sacrifice anything—”

Resisting {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Vega shouted and interrupted his words.

“Shut up, don’t be so naive!!”

Under the intense pressure that compressed the space, it should have been impossible to resist. Yet even so, Vega furiously insisted.

“Besides, it’s common knowledge that the world is a cruel place.”

Vega had survived under a harsh environment. Therefore, his words carried weight.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| involuntarily became silent, allowing Vega to speak.

“My boss, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, was trying to resist all that absurdity. Well, looking back on it now, I wonder how he could have done it with such a small amount of strength. But even so, I believed in that person. I was ready to take his head if he showed any weakness, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had a tricky character—he never let his guard down. And sure enough, he pretended to be manipulated, didn’t he?”

“…So what? That {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is no longer of this world, either.”

“Yes, that’s right. Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| couldn’t do it. In the face of such an insurmountable gap in strength, no matter how idealistic or righteous one may be, it’s all meaningless.”

It was true that he had wanted to make fun of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| when he heard about him being manipulated. However, Vega had sensed a dangerous feeling from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in his heart. He thought it could have been a habit acquired throughout his life, but it seems that he had instinctively realized that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not being manipulated.

He was glad that he did not get carried away with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and when he learned that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was killed by Jahil, he lamented the impermanence of the world.

That is why Vega told {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“A world where everyone can live happily ever after is just an illusion, after all. That’s why there’s no choice but to be honest, right?”

“’Honest,’ you say?”

“That’s right. As long as the immutable truth that might makes right remains unchanged, the only right thing to do is to stand at the top.”

Vega reaffirmed that power was justice. No matter how beautiful an idea was, it was meaningless if it could not be realized. Conversely, as long as the idea could be realized, anything was allowed.

In short, all that mattered was that you don’t lose. No matter how vicious an act was, it would be justified as long as you were not defeated.

No matter how cowardly you were, you would win as long as you survived to the end. That was Vega’s way of life.

From that perspective, a defeated {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was worthless. It was difficult to understand how {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was much stronger than himself, would mourn for a loser.

“You are strong, General. Even Jahil, who defeated {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, is no match for you. That Velzard woman is also a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but I think you’re better than her. Of course, you’re better than that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| guy.”

“…”

“That’s why, from now on, you’re the boss. No one’s going to have a problem with that.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was strong, so it was a natural conclusion, as Vega asserted this without hesitation.

“You are a simple man,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said.

“Cut out the flattery, I’m embarrassed.”

I didn’t mean it as a compliment, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sighed. At the same time, however, he realized that his grief over the loss of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was fading.

Perhaps that was Vega’s way of consoling him, he suddenly realized.

“Power, huh? Certainly, there is little to lose in that regard.”

Although he had lost {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the power had returned to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. There was a little loss, but that was because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had summoned the last of his strength to entrust it to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

It was proof that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s friend cared for him.

If so, he could not let it go to waste.

It may be wrong to intentionally take away the power of a comrade like Vega did, but the result was still the same. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not intend to blame Vega, and now, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| even felt a sense of kinship with Vega.

“Very well. From now on I will be king in place of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama. I swear to you that I will defend the throne until Veldanava-sama is restored.”

Now that he had made up his mind, the only thing left to do was to act.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had always been submissive to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Because of that, he had kept his true body hidden in order to keep a low profile, but now there was no longer any reason for him to hold back.

In order to fully utilize the power {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had left him, it was now time to unleash everything and dwell in the main body he had hidden in the other world.

“It’s been a long time since I revealed my true self.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the first servant created by Veldanava, was very much like his creator.

In contrast to Veldanava’s long, jet-black hair that seemed to hold the radiance of the stars of the world itself, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had long, silvery white hair that represented a shining light.

His slitted eyes were cool, shimmering like blue stars. Rather than calling them beautiful, it would be more correct to call them divine. And in those eyes, there was a will of steel filled with determination.

It almost seemed like a lie to say that he had once looked like a fake doll.

The gender could still be seen as either male or female, but that is because he was too beautiful.

As befitting of his “beauty,” he had a tremendous presence.

All the powers that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had gathered belonged to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Under the control of Manas ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ there were four Angelic Ultimate Skills excluding the three, ‘Knowledge King {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|,’ ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Uriel,’ and ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Sariel.’ The related powers associated with the Skills were also still alive and well in the form of information.

In addition, the factors of Velzard and Velgrynd, two True Dragons, had become flesh and blood.

In terms of strength, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was now more substantial than ever before.

“Amazing…really, he’s a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|…” Vega swallowed and muttered to himself, his true thoughts leaking out unintentionally.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was radiating such a powerful energy. He was no longer the same person as before.

“Vega, you have woken me up. I thank you.”

“Heh, it’s okay.”

Vega smiled, a little embarrassed, but he quickly made up for it and added a few more words with his usual sulky expression.

“But don’t forget. I’m always aiming for you. I’m no match for you now, so I’ll follow you, but if you show any weakness, I’ll eat you!”

Undoubtedly, this was Vega’s true intention, even if he was trying to hide his embarrassment. Even though he understood this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded his head happily.

“Hm, I’m counting on you.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiled with a chilling atmosphere that was completely different from before.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|: waddup, bunnyboi?" class="full"/>

Chapter 1

The First Showdown

In the former {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, at the planned construction site of {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim’s new capital, a battle to the death was taking place.

Fighting against the antlion Peliod, was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

In all honesty, it’s not in my character to fight so seriously…

The battle was so hopeless that she wanted to complain about it.

Peliod, who nullified magic, was the worst match for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Even the nuclear magic Nuclear Cannon, which she shot at close range, was reflected as if it were only natural.

Peliod was able to reflect all kinds of magic with the prism barrier around her. Moreover, Peliod’s prism barrier was not limited to magic, but also applied to a certain amount of emission-type techniques.

Peliod was a natural enemy of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who wielded magic as their weapons.

At this rate, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would not even be able to buy time. She was bitter at her own helplessness. And then, an unexpected helper appeared.

“Let me help you.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had given up the command of his unit to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, joined {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with those words. Although he normally should have been supporting {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, each of the Winged Beast Knights was a genuine warrior. They moved appropriately even without being ordered to do so, and their units were well organized. The morale of the whole army was improved when the commander and the second-in-command fought in the front rather than stayed in the rear.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was usually the one always running off, but this time, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took the lead.

“You know, you can tell this guy is serious trouble, right?”

“Well, yeah. But I’m still a better match than you, right?”

That was a good point.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| specialized in magic, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s strength lay in hand-to-hand combat. Even against an opponent who cannot use magic, there was a high possibility that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could still find a way.

“Well, I suppose that’s right. In that case, I’ll fight with this, too.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to use her magic sword to find a chance to win the battle, though she had intended to do so from the beginning.

Thus, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with her sword at the ready and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in his half-beast form were now facing the beautiful and bewitching Peliod.

It was two against one. Even so, they were overwhelmingly disadvantaged in terms of combat strength.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| stepped in and swung her sword.

With such masterful skill, it was hard to believe that she was an amateur until just recently.

While it was true that she only started learning it as a hobby, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had an obsessive personality. In her free time, she practiced over and over again, repeating the katas that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had shown her. The result was the brilliance of her technique, learned in a very short period of time.

But sadly, Peliod was always one step ahead.

“Tch, it’s a fake. It’s so elaborate that you can hardly distinguish it from the real thing…”

That’s right, the moment she was sure that she had cut her, Peliod disappeared, scattering into particles of light.

For a moment, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought it was an afterimage, but she soon realized that it wasn’t because the next moment, Peliod split into multiple bodies.

Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Ultra Intuition’ couldn’t see them, and none of them were distinguishable from the real thing.

This is impossible, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought.

She was hoping that she could help {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| even just a little, but it would be all she could do just to buy a little more time.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had also come in to help, but that was little more than a drop in the bucket.

Well, honestly speaking, isn’t this still better than nothing?

This wasn’t something that could be solved just by two people fighting together. Peliod’s strength was exceptional.

And sure enough, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were attacked from all directions. It was all they could do to defend themselves from the onslaught of attacks, unable to tell which was the main body.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had quite the mercenary personality, so she never wasted time doing useless things. She wanted to reset this battle and give up on the fight.

However, dying was not an option.

I guess I could still be revived even if I did die, but that would mean disobeying {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama’s orders. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama would be furious, and I could never forgive myself either.

Therefore, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could not afford to die.

On the other hand, leaving the front line was not possible, so this was a dead end, to put it simply.

Because of such contradictory thinking, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s movements slowed down. Not one to miss an opportunity, Peliod’s poisonous fangs took aim at her target—

“Don’t just stand there!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| kicked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| out of the way.

It was a poison that could kill even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, despite its fantastically beautiful glow. “Ow, that hurts—thank you.”

“Mm.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lightly responded to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s honest thanks and resumed his attack on Peliod. He repeatedly swung a series of seemingly futile claw attacks, scattering the countless clones.

It was completely pointless as long as they couldn’t tell real ones apart from the fakes. This, however, didn’t dissuade {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| from his brute-force approach.

“Hey, you’re weaker than me, so why haven’t you given up?” it slipped out of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“You’re pretty rude,” he declared. “Well, that’s fine. If you survive, you can win. As {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san said, it doesn’t matter as long as you can survive and win the next time.”

In essence, now was the time for them to gather clues on how to carry on, that’s why they had to persist, as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was satisfied with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s surprisingly serious answer. And she agreed.

“I’m a competitive person myself, but you’re pretty good too. I’ll give you that, Black Leopard Fang {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

“Thank you, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono.”

“You don’t need to be so up-tight with me, you know?”

“I’ve made mistakes because of that before. Also, I don’t think we have the time to be talking so leisurely.”

Unlike {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was serious. Even if he couldn’t win, he did not turn away from the fight and launched more ferocious attacks on Peliod. With a jet-black wind, he had been slashing at multiple clones with his claws, but they had been ineffective.

But now, perhaps feeling annoyed by it, Peliod struck back for the first time.

The scales swirled and drilled their way towards {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Even the smallest of scales could become a deadly weapon when they came together. If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were to be hit directly, his body would surely be turned to ribbons.

He understood this better than anyone else.

The difference in strength between the two was obvious and facing Peliod like this would normally be suicide. However, he had come to the same conclusion as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s defeat would be certain if he did not do his best at this point.

In that case, I have no choice but to do it, even if it is reckless. My life is worth a small price if I can divert attention even a little like this.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was proud to be a Beastketeer.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s fighting style was characterized in his ability to use high mobility to taunt his enemies and kill them with sharp claws. Although his defense was not the highest, it was not so much of a problem due to his evasive maneuverability.

This time, he was barely surviving due to his speed. The slightest lapse in concentration could result in death, despite the fact that they were already walking on a very dangerous tightrope.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| kept a keen eye on this.

Hmmm, it was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama’s subordinate, wasn’t it? I thought {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was just a weird guy who always talked about his love affairs with his girlfriend, but he really does show up when he has to. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the elite of the elite, and a follower of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, one of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| king pillars. That is why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was dazzled by those who lived their limited time to the fullest.

In contrast, what about herself?

Whenever she had a problem, her master {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took care of it, and then she could push the problem to her colleague {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Up until now, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had never felt desperation.

Could it be that I am more useless than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san?

No!

Something deep within {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s heart cried out that this was definitely not true. Perhaps it was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s true feelings of hating to lose, something she had almost forgotten.

As if proof of this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had almost given up, strongly stood up once again.

Although:

“Frankly, it’s impossible to beat her, isn’t it? That’s why, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san…let’s trouble her as much as we can!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still a very pragmatic realist, so she didn’t entertain any wild thoughts that she might win.

She calmly assessed the necessary conditions for a tactical victory.

“Huh, do you have a plan?” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked with a smile.

He sensed a change in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s mood and realized that their chances of winning had shifted from zero to something more positive.

Even now, scales were grazing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and his body was covered with an ever-growing number of ultra-fine scars. “Another deal…but I don’t have time to worry about that now, do I? All right. So, just what is this deal with the devil?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| still had the bitter memory of being deceived by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others through a previous deal.
