“It’s a common one,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied casually. “Just tell me your wish, and in return, I will ask for your soul.”

Because the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| race fed on human souls whether they were big or small, they were good at such contracts. They were well versed in all kinds of magic to meet the requirements of any kind of wish.

However, this was only true for the veteran {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who had survived from ancient times, not for newborn {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Needless to say, for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, this was a simple little trick that she could do at her leisure.

“I understand. I believe in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono, so I’ll take you up on that deal.”

Even though his right arm had been ground into a fine powder dust, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| agreed without even a groan of pain.

Upon hearing this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiled.

“That’s good, if you had hesitated about it even a little, I wouldn’t have been able to make it in time.”

That’s right, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had already been making preparations even before she heard {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s answer.

“And so, of course, my wish is—”

“The power to get through this!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded her head and activated the demonic contract to grant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s wish.

At that moment, the passage to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s soul opened as payment, allowing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to enter.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| paused for a moment before leaving her physical body to cut off her hesitation. Then, she entered {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s soul in her natural form as a spiritual life form.

This was also the Intrinsic Skill ‘Possession,’ a characteristic of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| race. It was sometimes used to take over the body of a person with whom one had made a contract, and the purpose of its use this time was something similar to that.

‹I really didn’t want to use this method. I can’t believe I had to leave the wonderful body that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama gave me on the battlefield like this.›

‹What the, what the hell’s going on here—?›

‹Calm down. We’re in the middle of a crisis right now, but we’re prolonging the time more than a million times over with ‘Thought Hyper-acceleration.’›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s calm voice gave {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| some time to comprehend the situation. It was true that the world seemed to have frozen, as if time itself had stopped.

‹…I see, so this is what the world looks like to those at the top.›

‹As for me, I still have a long way to go. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama is said to be about a hundred million times better, so even ritual magic that takes years to perform can be activated in an instant.›

‹Haha, that’s amazing…›

Rather than amazing, this was really just on a whole different level.

It was a world beyond {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s comprehension.

Ignoring {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s astonishment and dismay, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| began to explain.

‹There is plenty of time, or rather time to spare, so listen to me. I have separated from my physical body and returned to my original spiritual existence to inhabit you. I would normally take over the host and use his power as my own, but there is a procedure to do that, and to tell you the truth, it wouldn’t make me much stronger.›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| excelled in physical combat, especially in close combat. His skill level had also been greatly improved by training with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

On the other hand, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had only just taken up swordsmanship as a hobby. Peliod specialized in magic, so she was able to use it against her to some extent, but she would soon be defeated. Therefore, she decided to let {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| take the lead.

However, this did not mean that she would do nothing.

‹I inhabited you so that we could concentrate our forces.›

‹What do you mean?›

‹You should continue to focus on your evasive maneuvers. As it was, you’d have been killed within ten—no, five minutes, but if we combine our powers—›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| inhabited {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| by means of a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s contract. She then decided to surrender all of her power to him.

‹…If I use that power, you think I can defeat him?›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s intuition whispered to him that it couldn’t be that simple.

And he was right.

‹She’s not an opponent you can beat with just that. She seems to have more of a “vision” than I do.›

Peliod also had compound eyes that could read all kinds of information. It was because she was clearly aware of the flow of magicules that she was able to reflect any kind of magic.

This was obvious when she was able to throw back {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Abyss Annihilation’ in her first move. This fact proved that Peliod was more skilled in handling magic than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Naturally, her ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ was also better than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s.

‹So then, what are we going to do?›

‹You’ll do everything you can to stay alive. Of course, you’re not the only one. I’ll help you, too.›

While {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took the initiative in melee combat, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| herself intended to fight with magic. The plan was to mitigate the attacks on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with the assumption that this might not work either.

‹I see. So the plan is to increase our odds of survival as much as possible.›

‹That’s right. The tactical victory here is to survive until someone comes along who can defeat her. And if we can get her attention and keep her out of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama’s way, then we have nothing to complain about.›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded his head in agreement.

‹In other words, this is a way to buy time, right?›

‹It’s the only way. There’s a clear difference in ability, so it can’t be helped. But don’t worry. According to my calculation, we should be able to last for 20 minutes.›

‹Haha, that’s very encouraging…›

I don’t feel assured at all, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| couldn’t help but laugh.

But he pushed forward.

As much as it hurt to admit, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was weak. He had decided that the weak had their own way of fighting and that he would do his utmost to achieve that.

And so, the battle entered its second round.

Now, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were fighting as one, and because their existence values were also added together, it was increasing. However, their combined existence value was still less than one million, which was not much higher than that of Peliod.

Even so, thanks to the much improved performance, they were able to compete with her.

One of the reasons for this was that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| no longer cared about his physical injuries anymore since {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had started to shoulder the damage.

And he no longer cared about physical exhaustion either.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had decided to stop worrying about the various problems and had switched to a full-throttle combat style, giving up the long-term battle once and for all.

Of course, such an action would shorten the time limit of the active battle. Nevertheless, the reason such a strategy was successful was that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was supplying magicules.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘beast form’ had three stages.

The first was the normal {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| form. This was the most balanced form and the least burdensome.

The second was the leopard-headed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| form. This form was versatile and specialized in fighting.

The third was the fully animalized form. It was the fastest in terms of speed alone. However, it was not suitable for combat against humans, as it could not handle most of the skills {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been trained for.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was now in the most powerful leopard-headed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| form.

This form was not magicule-efficient, and exerting his full strength meant his body suffered damage. He had been fighting with a cautious approach, always controlling his power and releasing it at a moment’s notice. Even if he was damaged, he was able to manage it because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| have a high regenerative ability. However, it was not good for a long-term battle because it consumed stamina and magicules to maintain such a high regenerative capacity.

But now, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was able to put all these concerns aside and concentrate on fighting. His lost hand was regenerated, and he was able to use his full strength.

It was all thanks to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| protected {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| by taking his soul into her mental body. This was made possible by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s Unique Skill ‘Discerner.’ With this Skill, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could form a connection beyond time and space with those whom she knew, and she could control the soul more perfectly by using this Skill together with the demonic contract.

As a result, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would take a lot of damage, but that was about it. She showed off her demonic nature and endured it with all kinds of resistance.

However, painful things still hurt.

‹Seriously, I hate insect types. For direct attacks on the mind, ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ is meaningless.›

It was the accumulation of each of these factors that gave insectars their superiority over {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Because the compatibility was so one-sided, an insectar would always win between two opponents of the same level of skill.

Combined with these unfavorable conditions, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s damage was quickly accumulating.

Nevertheless, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still alive and well, and at the expense of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the battle remained competitive.

Besides, there was one piece of good news.

‹I knew it. She was sticking around longer than I thought she would, but now I know why.›

‹Hmm?›

‹No, you don’t have to listen to me.›

Muttering to herself, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| explained.

‹As expected, she is specialized in magic and seems to have taken damage from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama’s magic. I thought there was no way she could repel such a huge magic without any risk.›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Abyss Annihilation’ had the power to destroy even a planet depending on how it was used. Because Peliod had faced the attack head on, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought that there must be some kind of anomaly.

She was not strong enough to prove it, but she was finally convinced of it once she inhabited {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and made full use of ‘Discerner.’

‹Then, if we aim at that weak part—can we win?›

‹That’s impossible. It’s only because she’s weak that she’s not ready to attack, but her defenses are ironclad. Still, on the other hand, it’s good for us too.›

Hearing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s answer, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was silent for a moment. Then he sighed heavily.

‹As expected, I guess we’ll just have to keep going until reinforcements arrive…›

It was a regrettable and undesirable conclusion, but it was the only one they could come to.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gave up and concentrated on Peliod to fulfill his role.

………

……

…

And then, around forty minutes had passed.

‹…We’ve worked hard, haven’t we?› {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said.

‹Too tired to talk. Can’t do it anymore. I’m seriously gonna die.›

Even though he was wounded all over, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was alive. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was protecting his soul and taking the damage, was barely conscious. Considering that she had thought twenty minutes was the limit, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was very satisfied with the result.

However, it was a result of exhausting everything she had.

Peliod, on the other hand, was in good shape. Her movement was even better than it was at the beginning of the battle, which meant that she was recovering from the damage inflicted by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Strategically, this was a great victory, but tactically, this was a defeat.

But that was okay, because both {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had done their part.

‹Tch, I’m so upset, just when I got a girlfriend too.›

‹What’s that? Is that why you worked harder than expected? Well, I’ll give you credit for exceeding my expectations, so as a reward, I’ll pass on your message to her.›

Since they could no longer stand, all they could do now was wait for death. And so, they made light talk with each other.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wanted to enjoy the memories he had of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, whom he had come to care for, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| prevented him from doing so.

‹You are the devil!›

‹Yes. I am a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and so?›

‹That’s right. It’s so sad that you don’t get my sarcasm.›

‹Well, even I’ll feel troubled if you praise me so much.›

‹I’m not praising you, okay?›

‹Ah, yes. Well, I guess so.›

Through this intense battle, they had become friendly enough to engage in such banter.

And so, while drowning their fears of death and the humiliation of defeat, they impatiently waited for that moment.

However, then…

Without changing her expression, Peliod held out her hand. The magic-activating part of her body that was destroyed by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s magic had been restored, so magicules could now be used more efficiently.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was lying on his side and unable to move, could be dealt with at any moment.

Peliod joyfully awaited {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s screams of death, not imagining that he and his comrade would be talking casually to each other to prolong the moment. Peliod did not feel any respect for the ones who had made things so difficult, and only pursued the pleasure that her instincts demanded.

Dense compressed magicule rays flashed from Peliod’s fingertips, only to scour the ground, rather than penetrate {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

A hobgoblin had leapt out of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s shadow, grabbed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s leg and thrown him down.

“Whoa! My appearance, wasn’t it so perfectly timed?” a giddy voice echoed throughout the battlefield.

The owner of that voice, needless to say, was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

In order to break out of this critical situation, he had rushed to the scene as a reinforcement and appeared in full force.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not the only one to arrive.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, a red-haired beauty in a scarlet military uniform, caught {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as he flew toward her. She held {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| firmly to her chest and retreated to the back to protect him from Peliod’s attack.

Score, is what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought to himself, but no one else would know.

And finally, Ranga, who appeared at the end, stood in the front to protect {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and intimidate Peliod who was trying to pursue him. He then launched an ‘Apocalypse Howling ’ without hesitation and succeeded in slowing down Peliod’s movement.

Thus, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| within him were saved from certain death.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had returned to the body she had left behind, stood up and spoke:

“Wow, as expected of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama! I believed that you would definitely come to save me!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, whose eyes were sparkling brightly, was actually a fan of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Eh, is that so? I’m a bit embarrassed.”

“As one of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, please show me your cool side!!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was flattering {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

She was not trying to stir things up, but really meant it from the bottom of her heart.

“Well then,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said, now getting his mojo back, “when this battle is over, let’s go on a date…”

“Oh, I’m ready for that kind of thing!”

It wasn’t a feeling of love or anything similar, so this was a point that should not be misunderstood.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| then retreated from the front line with the rest, leaving {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with a drooping head.

Thus, the collapse of the front was prevented by the efforts of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

After a change of players, the battle was brought to the third round.

A while after the outbreak of the Great War, several non-aggression zones had been formed on the battlefield. In these zones, battles between transcendent beings were taking place, and those who were not strong enough would be reduced to dust simply by approaching these zones.

Above the battlefield, the one-on-one battle between Frey, one of Milim’s {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and Insect General Torun, was becoming more intense than ever.

The Soaring Flock and Milim’s Guards could only watch from a distance to avoid being caught up in the aerial battle between the two forces who were leaving even the speed of sound behind. The same was true for the flying insects under Torun, who were spreading out in wide disarray among their ranks.

Thus, it seemed that victory or defeat would be left to the final battle between the two forces in the battlefield in the sky, but this was evidently a mistake. Looking at the battlefield from a bird’s eye view, only the forces of one side continued to decrease.

“Kishishishi, you’re weak. You’re quite good at running away!”

At first, Frey went on the offensive, but after her signature claw attack was evaded, she had been on the defensive.

No, she had actually attacked several times, but those were of no use to Torun, and she did not even feel like a threat to him. If she had to be honest, there was probably nothing that stood out to him about her other than her speed.

Of course, Torun was not the kind of guy who would let his guard down, which was the reason why the battle dragged on for this long…but he was beginning to think that it was time to end it.

That’s why he had said what he did, but Frey only snickered in response.

“Oh, is that how you see it? In that case, I should be grateful.”

“What?”

Torun tilted his head, not understanding the meaning. She should have been the one feeling cornered, but Frey’s expression showed a definite smile of composure.

“Thank goodness you are an idiot.”

“You what?”

“The most important factor in a battle, just what do you think it is?”

“Speed.”

“Well, that is also correct. However—”

Certainly, Frey agreed that speed was the most important factor. At the same time, however, there was a more important factor that should not be forgotten.

It was not based on physical ability, but rather on intelligence. In other words, it was the way that one fought. When two fighters of the same level of ability clashed with each other, the outcome of the fight depended greatly on whether or not they thought about how to fight.

In this case, the current battle situation was proof.

As soon as her first attack was avoided, Frey knew that this fight would be a prolonged one. She decided that it was important to take away the enemy’s strength without getting fatigued, so she adjusted her fighting style to one that sought optimum efficiency.

This tactic was not limited to herself but also included her subordinates.

In other words, Frey controlled the situation of the battle to her own advantage by involving the enemy forces in the aftermath of the battle between herself and Torun.

Frey’s most notable point was her intelligence in using Torun’s own power to drive the enemy forces to the brink of destruction.

This was Frey.

This was the true nature of the cunning Sky Queen.

Frey laughed, and Torun finally understood what was going on.

“Wha?! You, from the very beginning, were aiming for this…”

“Well, what do you think?”

“Impertinent… But you still can’t get a scratch on me, so I’m the one who’s gonna win!!”

Enraged, Torun accelerated and closed in on Frey.

However, this, too, was predicted by Frey.

Torun’s aerial attacks were so troublesome that even a {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Seed class would be unable to see them, but Frey was a different story. By observing his way of fighting many times, she could see through the patterns and even calculate predicted attack points based on Torun’s initial velocity.

It was dangerous to make assumptions in these situations due to the existence of powerful figures who ignored the laws of physics completely, but in the case of Torun, she had already confirmed that he was bound by the laws of the Cardinal World.

That is why she explained to him:

“Assumptions are dangerous. I’m quite timid, so it takes me a long time to be sure.”

By the time Frey finished, Torun had reached the predicted position.

And what Torun noticed was the pain of fingernails piercing through his chest exoskeleton.

Torun’s shiny metallic exoskeleton was not as strong as an alienium fist. If so, adamantite would be strong enough to pierce it…and the result was the current reality.

“…Huh?”

Torun was distraught, but it was already too late.

Despite his desperate attempts to resist, none of Torun’s powers were activated. The moment Frey’s claws got to him, the victor had already been decided.

And inside Torun’s chest, which had been pierced through, there was the magic nucleus that was crucial for the insectar. Frey’s claws were clutching it…

“So then, good-bye.”

Torun’s magic nucleus was brilliantly shattered.

And thus concluded Torun’s death.

Lucia and Claire congratulated Frey.

“Thank you for your hard work, Frey-sama.”

“Well done, Frey-sama. From here, we will conduct the full-scale sweeping operation of the site.”

Frey nodded gracefully.

“Yes, please do. I’m really tired, but the battle is far from over. I don’t think I should be resting either.”

Frey looked around the battlefield.

In her line of sight, she could see her comrades struggling in the battle.

Frey had the upper hand from start to finish, but there were others who did not.

Although the disparity was not as great as that of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s team, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had come as a reinforcement, was showing desperate resistance while being tossed around by the enemy.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was by no means weak. He had acquired new strength and was also growing to be one of the strongest. However, his opponent was just too strong. Insect General Beathop was a formidable opponent who was too much for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s existence value was 1.26 million, while Beathop’s was over 1.7 million. While the difference in existence value was not a decisive difference in strength, Beathop’s combat ability, such as his physical ability, was directly related to his existence value by a high percentage. He was an insectar who did not possess any special powers and instead specialized in close combat.

He was the worst match-up for the all-around versatile {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been alone, he would have been defeated long ago. The reason why this had not yet happened was that he had comrades fighting alongside him.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, are you all right?”

“Mm. I’m still alive and well! Rest assured, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had fought together against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| during the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| invasion, were once again teaming up against Beathop.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also the leader of the Winged Beast Knights, but she left that role to her subordinates. This time it had taken longer to leave because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had given up the command first, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not suitable for commanding, and she would always relieve herself of her duties after she finished raising everyone’s morale.

Rather than leading, it was better to slaughter as many enemy generals as possible in order to make the most of one’s individual strength.

She was well aware of this and did not hesitate to throw herself into the battle this time as well. However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s forces were not so easy to defeat, and she was forced to give her all even though she should have had the advantage of two-on-one.

“Good, good! This is what a battle should be like,” Beathop laughed loudly.

Beathop was drunk on his power. He enjoyed defeating the weak with his overwhelming strength, and for him, a battle was but a game where he steamrolled his opponents. In this respect, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, his current opponents, were just the right combination.

Taking them one at a time would have been unsatisfactory, and this situation of overturning a numerical disadvantage greatly excited Beathop. That’s why he was enjoying the battle, even though he could have settled it much earlier.

Such impure intentions were easily conveyed.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were desperately trying to find a way to win and lamenting their lack of ability.

“I have faced many strong opponents over time, but you seem to be the strongest of them all.”

“Oh, I see. I’m flattered to hear that, but I’m not going to take it easy on you!”

Beathop’s voice sounded really happy.

In contrast, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke in displeasure.

“Ah, that’s right. If you’re a warrior, be a warrior. Don’t play with your enemies!”

Beathop did not intend to cut corners, but he certainly wanted to prolong the fun. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| saw through that and were offended.

However, it was thanks to that, that they were still safe, which was more frustrating than anything else. It was humiliating to be saved by an enemy’s pride.

Indignantly, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took a recovery potion.

Similarly, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| chugged the expensive {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| without hesitation.

Despite this, the countless wounds on their bodies showed no sign of recovery. The reason was simple; their existence values had exceeded the prescribed amount of the recovery potion.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had also evolved under the influence of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s awakening, and now her existence value was enhanced to just under 500,000. The principle of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s was to activate cells by means of magicules, and even to compensate for missing parts, thereby restoring cells to their original state. That is why the two had used over a hundred recovery medicines during this battle. For minor injuries, simply sprinkling the potion on their bodies was effective, so the two of them were already completely soaked with potion.

“It’s a good thing that the taste has been improved. Though I’d like to refrain from taking any more recovery medicine for the time being.”

“I agree. At first, I thought the strawberry flavor was cool, but now I’m just hungry.”

Because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was more dependent on the recovery medicine than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, she appeared to be quite fed up with it.

For the past several months, the two had been learning the art of close combat against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. But now, that good fortune was about to come to an end as the atmosphere around Beathop changed.

“Hey, now, is Torun dead?”

The reason Beathop had been ignoring {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others who were exchanging pleasantries was because he had noticed that one of his comrades had been defeated by Frey.

On a stalemated battlefield, it was dangerous for one side to break off. Knowing this, Beathop decided that it was no longer the time to play around.

“It can’t be helped,” Beathop declared. “I wanted to take it easy, but I’m going to make a move.”

It wasn’t that he had been playing around, it was just that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others had been doing better than expected. Similar to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s strategy, Beathop, who did not want to go all out at this point, fought in such a way that he could leave some energy left over. Now, however, with the defeat of his comrades, he had shifted into a mode of destruction without thinking about the future.

“Kill” Leaving that mutter behind, Beathop disappeared.

Taking advantage of his leg strength, he immediately closed the distance with the force of an Instantmove and kicked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, of course, did not follow Beathop with her eyes, but rather with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.’ She had broken away from her old style of fighting with only her natural ability and had polished her skill-levels.

But even so…

Beathop’s moves were too fast.

It was only to be expected because this time he attacked with his full power, not caring about the damage to his own body.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| barely managed to protect herself with both arms, but the result was cruel. Her crossed arms were shattered, and she was hit with a powerful kick to the abdomen.

Hmm… Just one kick did that to her…

As a result, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s withdrawal from the battle was inevitable.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a warrior, and he did not make a habit of unnecessarily hurting his defeated opponents. That understanding was nothing short of humiliation, but perhaps it was not wrong. Beathop showed no mercy even to those who had lost their will to fight. It was Beathop’s belief that mercy led to carelessness. However, because low-level insectars did not have emotions, Beathop was a superior individual in that he understood the concept of affection, though it would not be a comfort for the adversary.

“I would love to explain it myself, but I won’t tell you!”

Beathop broke off the conversation and tried to put all his strength into his body once again, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| interrupted him with a laugh.

“That’s impossible,” he spoke confidently. “I just realized this, but your power cannot be used continuously, can it? Otherwise, there would be no reason for you to waste your time talking with us.”

Beathop’s speed exceeded Apito’s, and the power of his fists and kicks was as heavy as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s. Those movements were very difficult to recognize and were almost impossible to avoid. That is why, on the contrary, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| wondered about them.

Even Apito-dono said that it was easy to accelerate but difficult to stop suddenly. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono used magic to twist the laws of inertia to make her mysterious movements possible, but there is no sign of this person using magic. In that case, the only thing I can think of is…

It was either the control of the law via special ability, or by brute force.

With these two options in mind, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| continued his observation and noticed that Beathop was using ‘Ultraspeed Regeneration’ on his body after each attack. In other words, Beathop was demonstrating combat ability that surpassed his limits through forceful brute strength.

If so, there was only one way to deal with it.

If Beathop kept on attacking with such unreasonable force, he would eventually self-destruct. All {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had to do was concentrate on defense and wait for that moment.

However, these were also attacks from a superior opponent who had surpassed their limits. He would be killed instantly by a single blow if he was not careful, and he would continually be walking on a tightrope that was much too dangerous.

Beathop’s Limit Break attack, which required much sacrifice, was several times faster than Apito and could kill {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with a single blow depending on where it hit. A limb was sure to be damaged, and even taking a scratch would be a big deal.

Thinking that it would be difficult to continue to deal with such attacks, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked Beathop to reconsider his tactics. “…”

There was an awkward silence.

It was broken by Beathop’s loud laughter.

“Gyahahahaha! Great, that’s great! Really, you’re weak, but I can’t get enough of you!” After laughing like that, Beathop’s mood changed once again.

“I acknowledge you. That’s why, I’ll take you seriously!”

The bet had failed.

“What?!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought it was a bad idea.

He had made such a big show of pretending to be the better guy, and now he couldn’t back out.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| behind him, so running away was out of the question.

Now, he had no choice but to leave it to luck and do his best to survive the situation.

At least, if I had my Vortex Spear in hand…

The lizardmen’s secret treasure, the spear, had just been tossed away. He wanted to go pick it up, but he did not think Beathop would allow him to do so.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was resolved to the situation.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, no longer thinking about the spear, stood up proudly and puffed out his chest as usual.

“Well, I agree. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, those guys are right. “I don’t like it. As I thought, the chills are getting stronger.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| muttered to himself and looked up at the sky which had begun darkening before he knew it.

The chills running down his spine were telling him that killing Saril had been a mistake.

As {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| surmised, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also had a sense of urgency.

This doesn’t make sense. The pressure from the enemy has not changed at all since the beginning of the war…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was treating Tishorn, who could slice through anything by vibrating the alienium exoskeletons on both of her arms, like a child. She did not finish off Tishorn because she was having the same concerns as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Many lives had been lost on the battlefield.

The damage to her allies had been minimized by the use of restorative medicine, and the injured were quickly switched with their replacements, so there were no casualties. However, the insectar army had been continuing the onslaught without regard to the loss of life, and they had already been reduced to less than half of their initial strength.

Despite this, the enemy’s strength that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sensed with her hyper-intuition’ was still intact and undiminished.

The moment that Frey defeated Torun was the moment that this feeling of discomfort became a certainty.

Even though one of the enemy generals had been defeated, nothing had changed. This meant that even the death of the Insect General had no effect on the insectar army—no, or perhaps it could be worse than that.

In the worst case, it was even possible that the Insect Generals’ deaths themselves were one of the enemy’s schemes…

It can’t be. As expected, that’s just…

It wasn’t impossible, she couldn’t say for sure that it wasn’t true.

A colleague of hers, Zalario, had once complained to her about them. “They are really persistent,” he had said. “They can be a nuisance even if you beat them, so you have to choose the right place.”

At that time, she thought it was a rare occurrence for the normally taciturn Zalario, and she only felt that he seemed to be tired, but now she realized that the meaning of his comment was very significant.

Back then, she had already decided that it was not her job to deal with the insectars, so she had no intention to consult with him from the beginning and had not listened to what he had to say.

This wasn’t just {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s problem, but also a bad habit of the phantoms as a whole, led by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| still regretted that they should have informed each other of the major problems at least.

All that said, it was a bit too late for that.

Since she knew nothing about the enemy, she had no choice but to be flexible and seek the most appropriate response according to the situation. With that in mind, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| continued to observe the battlefield while dealing with Tishorn.

Then, the battle situation changed quickly without any decisive moves being made.

Torun, followed by Beathop and Abart, were defeated. Even though so many enemy generals fell, the enemy’s strength did not decrease even slightly. With such a result, there was no room to doubt that this was a part of the enemy’s strategy.

It’s dangerous. We should not take down any more Insect Generals.

Although they were enemies that must be defeated, safety was the priority. If something unforeseen was happening, they had to remove the cause of anxiety without being hasty.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| tried to issue a warning, but it was a little too late. By that time, even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had already taken care of Saril.

Only four Insect Generals remained. Tishorn, whom {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was facing, Mujika, whom {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was holding off, Peliod, whom {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Ranga were struggling with, and finally, Zess, who was fighting with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in another dimension of combat. Half of them had already been defeated.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s blank expression turned dark for a moment, as if something bad was about to happen. Tishorn did not miss it and smiled.

“Hohoho, so you’ve noticed it. After all, the lowly Insect Generals are just the opening act. With His Grace’s great power, whether I am present or absent, will not affect the big picture.”

As it was, Tishorn was a high-ranking Insect General. She was the fourth most powerful. Tishorn’s existence value is a little over 1.8 million, which was not that much different from Beathop’s. Still, the fact that she had been part of the upper echelon of the Insect Generals for so long was proof of her power.

“Dimensional Slash.”

The shockwaves emitted from Tishorn’s arms became slicing extensions that slashed and tore at everything in all directions. The effect of the shockwave extended to the dimensional realm, and although the dimensional slash was instantly restored by the world’s healing power, it was impossible for the materials on the surface of the slash to withstand it.

Naturally, even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was no exception.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could see through it at a glance and did not make the mistake of suffering such an attack, however, she still recognized that Tishorn was a threat.

Partly because of that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was acting in a way that would minimize the damage, but at this stage, she was not sure if it would be a good thing or a bad thing.

“Dimensional Slash.”

Tishorn released another move, and a vicious shockwave came flying in.

While avoiding it with a comfortable margin, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was gradually becoming impatient.

“Like a foolish one-trick pony, you keep repeating attacks that don’t work.”

“Hohoho, that is an interesting point you make. It’s up to me, not you, to decide whether it works or not.”

Tishorn’s reply was plausible. No one was a fool to believe the words of their enemy. If she thought it would not work, she would have stopped it long ago. Tishorn was repeating the same attack because she believed it would work.

And that was precisely why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not like it. That is why she tried to stop Tishorn by inciting her to think it was useless. When that failed, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| reconsidered Tishorn.

You really are experienced in fighting, taking the optimal action without any hesitation. Simply winning would be easy, but neutralizing her without killing her is tough even for me…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had already seen through Tishorn’s ability. The gap between her and Tishorn was vast, and she could say without a doubt that Tishorn was inferior to her. However, this was only true if she had not been injured in the battle with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s wounds were all healed, and it was true that she was in good physical condition. However, her lost energy had yet to be completely replenished, and the situation was far from perfect. Otherwise, she would have neutralized Tishorn long ago. The failure to do so was the reason for her current situation.

Even so, there was no time left for hesitation.

“Your Honor, please shine your light upon us!!” Tishorn shouted, and at the same time, her combat ability greatly increased. Like Insect General Saril, she had voluntarily triggered Overdrive.

However, there was one thing that was different from Saril.

Tishorn had full control over Overdrive and could effectively utilize the time limit.

“Dimensional Slash, Final Dance.”

It was an attack incomparable to anything that had come before.

A spectacular scene unfolded, with more than 10,000 dimensional slashes occurring, making it impossible for any human being to escape from this space of death and destruction.

In contrast, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| took action—she did not run away from the scene, and simply stood tall.

No, that wasn’t it.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had given up on neutralizing Tishorn and decided to go all out.

“Divinity release,” said {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| lightly.

That was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s signal to go all out.

The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| equipment she had been wearing regained their starry radiance. The circulation of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s magicules had restored their full performance.

And in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s hand, was a huge double-edged sword. That was the Beast Slayer; it was the result of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s beloved longsword transforming into its true form.

Against the cryptids, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s nemeses, she had abandoned the idea of taking things easy. If she had been lenient, the damage would have continued to increase without stopping. She had always tried her best to eliminate cryptids with optimum efficiency. Therefore, once {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided to fight, there was no choice but to annihilate her enemies without any regard to the damages in the surroundings.

And now, her true power, which exceeded 20 million in existence value, was about to be demonstrated.

“Hohoho, it’s too late to get serious now!”

As Tishorn said, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was already trapped in the space of death. Since Tishorn’s interference prevented her from escaping through ‘Spatial Transportation,’ there was no way for her to avoid being sliced to pieces.

That’s how it should have been.

But the result was:

“This attack is nothing more than child’s play.”

It was true that a direct dimensional slash caused the space to rip open. And yet, just as the space returned to its original form, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s body was also restored to its original state.

“I-it can’t be?!”

“My body is connected not only to the material world but also to the spiritual world. This is nothing,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| explained indifferently, increasing her magicules as if to say that it was now her turn.

The Beast Slayer began to shine.

Upon seeing that dangerous light, Tishorn was bewildered by emotions that had arisen for the first time in her life.

My body is trembling. It can’t be, it can’t be that I’m afraid, right? Does this mean I’m frightened?!

She understood as such, but it was too late. There was nothing Tishorn could do.

“O vanishing one, may you scatter beautifully! ‘Planetes Bombardment’!!”

A massive slash indiscriminately rained down from the heavens, delivering a merciless yet fair death. Tishorn, who was caught in the blast, vanished into dust, unable even to show the dignity of a powerful opponent.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was struggling.

The enemy he faced was Insect General Mujika.

Mujika was a warrior-type insectar, clad in a garishly colored shell of a warrior’s armor, who wielded a sword with both hands.

Mujika’s strength was equal to that of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s.

Both sides refused to give an inch.

And their subordinates were also going at it back and forth.

The Yellow Numbers and Orange Numbers, who maintained an ironclad line of defense, were holding back a swarm of giant centipedes who were led by Mujika and were more than 30 meters in length. Because of the difference in size, teams had been formed to deal with each centipede.

Whenever they were injured, they would heal themselves with restorative medicine, and whenever they got tired, they would switch out with those in the rear to maintain the front line while avoiding overworking themselves. This was all the result of their regular training.

Therefore, the battle remained in a stalemate even after several hours had passed, though the most notable matter was the one-on-one battle between {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Mujika.

Mujika wielded a long sword with skill that could put a first-rate martial artist to shame, and judging by his high level of skill, it was hard to believe that he had developed this technique all on his own.

He could have been a reincarnated person from the other world, but that was not important. What was certain was that Mujika was a formidable opponent.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| caught the sword with his large shield. This shield was also a gem that had become a part of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and reached the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| level. It was akin to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s own flesh and blood and had been transformed to have properties similar to that of the exoskeleton of an insectar. Therefore, any minor damage could be repaired instantly.

The air shook and the impact was enough to even scatter plasma, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| kept a cool facade. In return, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| swung at Mujika with his Meat Cleaver.

However, Mujika was also a great fighter, and he anticipated his attack and parried it with his sword. Not only that, but countless legs popped out from the gaps in his armor and unleashed a barrage of blows as if to pierce through {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The action taken by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who appeared to be on the verge of a crisis, was to respond with a ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ counterattack.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| along with ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ effect of the Ultimate Gift ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| King Beelzebub,’ ‘Chaos Eater,’ bit at Mujika’s legs with erratic movements, as if it had a will of its own.

His legs would not be defeated either, and they were cloaked with an evil {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to cancel out {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Chaos Eater.’

However, such a battle suddenly came to an abrupt end.

“Hmph. Even Tishorn is dead. How surprising. I didn’t think the fighting force of this place would be this strong, but now His Grace’s preparations are complete.”

“Hm?”

“Well, it’s of no matter to you. It’s been a long time since I’ve met a warrior who can challenge me so well. I would have liked to compete with you more, but it’s almost time.”

Mujika said so nonchalantly and distanced himself from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Then, he took the remaining insectars and showed his readiness to retreat.

Even after seeing this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not let his guard down.

But then, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also noticed something.

Something is strange about the atmosphere of the battlefield. Could this intense fear be an omen of something to come…?

It was such an overwhelming sense of danger that he wondered why he had not noticed it before.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| looked up at the sky. Dark clouds were swirling around, and he had a feeling that something was about to manifest.

“All hands, maintain full alert!!”

At {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s command, even those who were undergoing treatment began to move.

His unusually ominous demeanor made it clear to everyone that the battle was not over.

As soon as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was rescued, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| scrambled to rebuild the front line.

Under {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s guidance, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had developed into a first-rate commander. Through the large-scale combat training in the labyrinth, she was able to train in all kinds of gruesome tactics and was therefore far more experienced than any tactician.

The three hundred {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| members under {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s charge were also veterans who had grown up together with him. They did not need to be ordered by him to take the best course of action.

Although they were only few in number, the war situation had been greatly improved.

Furthermore, the presence or absence of a commander alone could affect a war situation. With {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| back in the front line and in command, the Winged Beast Knights regained their vigor.

In this way, Milim’s forces gradually gained the upper hand, but…

In the midst of such an upswing, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was dying.

Peliod, whom he was facing, was an unbelievably dangerous opponent.

Her poisonous mist was so deadly that it could even kill {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had a high level of resistance to poison. It was not merely something that could kill if consumed, but something that would melt the skin and burn the flesh at the slightest touch.

The slightest contact with the skin caused extreme pain. Thanks to this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| realized the danger of the poisonous mist.

And then:

Wait a min…that’s dangerous! Dead, if this keeps up, I’ll be dead for sure!!

That’s what he decided less than 30 seconds after the battle started.

And so, without hesitation, he asked Ranga, who had rushed over for support, and decided to use the secret technique.

“Magic Wolf Unification!!”

Without a moment’s delay after entering the battle, he assimilated with Ranga.

Thus, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Ranga were transformed into a sinister two-horned humanoid black wolf. It was the correct course of action. If the decision had been made even a little later, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would have been killed in the battle, let alone Ranga.

“Now then, let’s do this!”

‹{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you may let loose with all my power.›

At first, the two were excited, but that enthusiasm soon faded away.

The reason was simple: Peliod was too strong.

The assimilation of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Ranga did not mean that their combat ability increased that much. The combination of Ranga’s latent abilities and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s sense of combat would only make them more powerful than the sum of their abilities. In other words, since {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s existence value was not that high, it was almost as if there was no change in the situation in terms of numbers.

Peliod, on the other hand, was a frightening presence from their point of view. Her existence value was 6.8 million, more than 15 times larger than that of the assimilated {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Ranga, and it was the second largest after Zess. Not only that, but she was also an extraordinary user of space-type abilities and could even reflect {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Abyss Annihilation.’ Even with their secret technique, she was a far superior existence.

The reason why they had not been defeated immediately was that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were good at physical close combat, while Peliod was better at magical mid-range and long-range combat.

Therefore, from the beginning of the battle until now, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been in a tense situation where there was no room to relax. They were able to keep the battle reasonably close, thanks to the fact that they could just barely maintain their advantageous position.

But even that was about to come to an end as Peliod’s condition changed.

‹{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, have you noticed?›

‹This is bad, Ranga-san. Somehow, isn’t she getting more and more powerful?›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Ranga were concerned about Peliod’s current condition as they were facing her. Compared to the beginning of the battle, there was a sense that her fighting ability had increased. As evidence of that, she was steadily responding to the duo’s movements more and more. Their feints were no longer working, and they were losing time on the offensive. Peliod’s vicious jabs were beginning to reach {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s side, though not to the extent that they were completely on the defensive.

Peliod had changed from previously launching monotonous attacks, to imbuing the intent to kill in each attack.

‹To grow in the middle of battle, it’s a foul play, don’t you think?›

‹It happens often. I have experienced it myself, so I shouldn’t be surprised if my enemies do the same…›

‹Well, that’s true, but it feels unfair when I’m the one being attacked…›

The two of them were complaining to each other about such things, but they were determined to brace themselves for the situation.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| understood.

They were the reinforcements, so no further help should be expected.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, whom {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| respected and who was always there for him no matter what, was also fighting on another battlefield. This time, the enemy was so powerful that they could not expect any help.

If anything, there was a possibility that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| might come. However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would prefer that didn’t happen, since it would put their home country at risk.

In other words:

‹Well, we have no choice but to do something ourselves.›

‹I agree. If the enemy is strong, we just need to become even stronger than them!›

So, in the end, they went with their guts.

As a commander, that was no good, but for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it gave him a reason to push himself.

As the phrase “fighting the last stand ” suggested, for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who always maintained the mindset to retreat, this situation in which he could not run away helped him to push himself harder.

“From here on out, I’m going for a quick and decisive battle!” With that enthusiasm, he accelerated his attack.

However, it all ended up in vain.

They even tried launching a two-stage attack to win the battle, taunting Peliod with ‘Dance With Wolves’ and at the same time unleashing the special attack, ‘Apocalypse Howling.’ However, even that was evaded.

Seriously?! That one was secretly trained, a special technique!!

This made {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| feel a sense of danger.

The same was true for Ranga.

{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. I understand Zess’s skill-level. He is strong, but I’m the one who will win.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| chose the Beast Roar, his best special technique. Uncaring of what would happen next, he unleashed his versatile diffuse-focused particle cannon without hesitation.

No, rather that’s what it was supposed to do.

And then, she spoke:

“How sad. My children were defeated by such an opponent.”

“I beg your pardon?” Frey asked, but was silenced shortly thereafter by a powerful blow to the abdomen.

“Guu, guhaa?!”

Despite coughing blood with a startled expression, Frey followed her instincts and removed herself from Peliod.

“I see, you have good intuition. That claw made me a little weak, but I could have killed you with two blows. But it makes sense now. Putting power aside, you have a lot of experience in combat. In that case, my children’s honor can be restored a little,” Peliod said as if singing.

Shifting his center of gravity to his right foot, he lightly moved his left foot forward. At the same time, he clenched his right fist and squeezes it at the waist, holding his left hand out in front of him as a check against Peliod.

And in the next moment, he exploded his power starting from the tiptoe of his left foot, using his own body as a cannonball and rushing forward. Then, he thrust his fist with all his strength and released a mass of fighting aura in the shape of a fist.

“Draconic Cannon!!”

The energy of the earth was integrated with his own fighting aura, and it coursed through his whole body from his toes, converging into a fist. Then he unleashed this special move—‘Draconic Cannon.’ It was a full-throttle attack with no restraint, and even the energy of the earth was combined with it. A divine blow that was powerful enough to be used against superior opponents.

This was the true essence of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the greater chaos spirit dragon {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“That’s an interesting technique. If I learn this, my children will become stronger.”

With a laugh, she easily deployed a space-manipulating magic circle to eliminate the Draconic Cannon.

But this was just as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| expected.

In fact, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not expect this would work from the very beginning, and his role was to be a decoy.
