Insect Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was stronger than Menace Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

But even so…

Even so, that did not mean that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would give up so easily.

“Ehh? Aren’t you a little bit petty for a man who calls himself a king?” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke hatefully.

But {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was even better at quarreling than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Huh, demonstrating bravado at this late stage of the battle, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| are all losers at heart.” He looked down on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| with the air of a victor, calm and composed.

“Perhaps you think you’ve already won? That’s being a little too arrogant in front of me.” Even with that retort, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s expression did not show any room for complacency.

After all, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s arms had been shattered by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ mere kick. It was difficult for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to even hold the Golden Gun, let alone grip a sword.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s skeleton was originally made of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s special orichalcum and had now evolved into hihiirokane. It possessed the strength, hardness, and viscosity equivalent to that of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| armor, and had indestructible properties.

And yet…

If she had been injured by a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| weapon, she would have understood, but it was unexpected that a mere kick could cause this much damage.

That alone made her aware of the threat level of Insect Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The secret was revealed as soon as she looked upon Insect Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s entire body.

His exoskeleton was shining in rainbow colors. It was the very brilliance of hihiirokane.

I didn’t expect to see hihiirokane all over his body…

Looking at his body, it was obvious that Insect Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the ultimate form of life capable of both offense and defense. His whole body was like a deadly weapon and the strongest shield.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| slowly observed the whole of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The silvery cilia running from his forehead to his back looked like long hair. However, upon closer inspection, each hair was covered with tiny protuberances that resembled the shape of a blade. Even the cilia were assumed to be made of hihiirokane, since they appeared to be iridescent when viewed from different angles.

Does this mean that each of those hairs is a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| blade? I don’t know how to manipulate them, but if I’m not careful, they might cut me into tiny pieces.

A pair of antennae were swaying on his forehead. Two pairs of wings on his back and hips glowed red, and three pairs of arms were alertly poised.

Those wings are also dangerous. They are terribly dense, but is it because they are compressed with energy? If I release them, the shape of the star might be altered…

It would probably be more destructive than {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s extreme magic. That’s how much energy she could feel from those two pairs of wings.

And then, there were the three pairs of arms.

One pair of arms was folded casually, but the other two pairs were ready for battle. The lowest arms, crossed in front of the abdomen, were ready to cast a spell at any moment. In addition, the arms in the upper part were discolored and deformed from the middle, becoming thin like a blade, and shining dully.

If the first blow had been made with those thin arms, it was highly probable that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s arms would have been amputated.

It looked like he was stepping on his son, but the reality was worse than that.

“What are you—”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s answer was a gurgling, grinding, chewing sound coming from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ feet.

That’s right. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was eating Zess, his son and head of the Insect Generals, right in front of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Ridiculous!” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| laughed. “My successor must be the strongest. Even more so than myself.”

“…”

“There is no way someone weaker than me can become the god of creation.”

Then suddenly, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| moved. With the mouth that had appeared on the sole of his foot, he had finished eating Zess. He had absorbed knowledge and experience in order to take Zess; power for himself. As evidence of this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ speech had become fluent without an accent.

And his power—

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| tried desperately to take a defensive position. But her hand would not move.

Not good!! If I get hit by that, I’ll take irreparable damage!!

Although her thoughts were running a million times faster than before, reality was truly merciless.

At least, it hadn’t been up until now in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s life up until now…

But apparently, this was not that moment.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ kick was caught by someone.

Then, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was out of the picture.

“Well, it can’t be helped. I’m still inexperienced, let’s just recover quickly.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| changed her mindset quickly and calmly. He, not in a mood to be shy about showing off his skills, had lifted all the restrictions he had imposed on himself and even displayed his ‘Dragon Body’ which he had never shown except when he was fighting against Milim. His limbs were covered with dragon scales while still retaining his human form. The whole body under his clothes was similarly protected other than at the joints.

Of course, this was not to say that his existence value increased, but only that the dragon man was exercising his power to the fullest. In other words, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was now in a state where all restraints and limitations were lifted.

“Heh, As expected of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san. I was curious to see if he was better than Zegion, but after all, it’s a close match!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was watching the battle, was impressed by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s strength.

Since {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was able to compete with this Mujika, it was easy to understand how insane he really was.

To be honest, Zegion would win in a serious fight. However, if Zegion was fighting with the same amount of power as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|…

“Why don’t we do this? Let me hear your name.”

“I’m {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Won’t you introduce yourself as well? It will be worth remembering if it’s a name coming from someone so fierce that it amuses me.”

Despite being enemies, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Mujika acknowledged one another. Especially Mujika seemed to have become more human after ‘Life Reconstruction,’ and his technique was less mechanical and more brilliant.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, perhaps sensing this change, sincerely approved of Mujika’s performance. Otherwise, he would not have exposed his full strength.

But this was still a battlefield, and both men were enemies. They acknowledged each other, but they were still trying to kill the other.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| laughed and brought out his left fist in a fluid motion. He pulled back his left fist faster than the speed at which he thrust it and used the recoil to throw a spinning kick.

This was a so-called feint, but in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s case, it was not the only thing. When he clenched his fist for the first time, he had compressed the air and shot it out. Moreover, since he mixed the air with fighting aura, the power of his fists was more powerful than that of a mana bullet.

Mujika had his sword ready in response to the fist, so he was able to repel the compressed air bullet. However, immediately after that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s kick cleanly entered the gap left by lifting the sword to the upper level.

“Nng.”

The force of the kick, which penetrated under Mujika’s armor, ran through his entire body and affected his physical functions. Needless to say, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s kicks were also filled with fighting aura.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a master of ‘Battlewill.’

Just as the school of the Dragon Fist had sprouted in the other world where Velgrynd had arrived, even here in the Cardinal World, a unique style had been passed down.

This style, which combined basic movements similar to those of traditional jiu-jitsu and physical manipulation of the body via fighting aura, also expressed the unrestrained spirit of Milim, the founder of the art.

There was no name for this school of art, but if it were to be named, it would be the Dracofist Style. Incidentally, there was no ritual of inheriting a soul as was the case in the Dragon Fist. The knowledge and experience accumulated by the person were all that they acquired.

The lifespan of a person in the Cardinal World varied widely and could be greatly extended depending on how that person lived. Simply by practicing discipline and taking care of one’s physical condition with Battlewill, one’s lifespan could be extended several times over, and if you were an ancestral pureblood like {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, you could even live over a thousand years.

In fact, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was over 2,000 years old. He was strong because he had spent all that time in training.

Mujika was hit by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s kick and instinctively took a step backward. Then he glanced at the impacted area and was astonished. His shell armor, which could not be damaged from any non-lethal attacks, had been dented and crushed.

The lower-ranked insectar soldiers had no sense of fear, so they repeatedly launched suicide attacks as ordered, no matter how superior they were. However, the higher ranks, due to their scarcity, instinctively understood the difference in strength between them and their opponents.

As an Insect General, his sense was quite accurate, and he could easily estimate his opponents’ fighting ability. However, this was limited only to direct abilities, so he was unable to detect Skill abilities. And, of course, he was unable to see how much the target had been trained without actually fighting them.

Mujika was now on the maximum alert against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| because of the blow he had just received. Although he had been empowered by Peliod, he calmly judged that he might lose if the battle was prolonged. In that case, the only thing he could do was to show his respect to his opponent by giving his all with his best technique.

“Taste my technique: Devouring Fangs.”

Mujika’s weapon, strictly speaking, was not a sword. It was alienium forged into a blade. And now that Mujika had evolved, it had become even sharper. Furthermore, Mujika’s mana was poured into the blade, which was comparable to a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| blade, and it had become so powerful that it could sever any substance. This blade approached {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| remained unmoving.

“Nuu!” Increasing his aura , he caught Mujika’s blade with his left arm.

That’s right, he caught it.

A hard and unpleasant sound echoed. It was a melody played by the shockwave generated by the collision of equal strength and hardness.

“How can this be…?!”

“Why are you surprised? If you had the spirit, you could easily use your own body as a weapon.”

It was not easy.

In this case, Mujika’s reaction was only natural. However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a man who was always trained to deal with the unreasonableness of Milim. He had no idea that his logic was insane to ordinary people, and he never doubted that it was normal.

Of course, it couldn’t be done with just willpower. It was a solid technique, though the reason was that he was covered with dragon scales.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| controlled his own fighting spirit and hardened his body. He anticipated where the attack would come and focused all his attention on that part of the body even if it might lower the defenses of other parts of his body. This had given his left arm enough defensive power to withstand {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| weapons, so it would be quite reckless to attribute it all to mere spirit. It was only possible because it was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s essence was of the Dragon God status that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would someday reach, and with his divine physical strength, he could compete with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| fighters with his guts in the name of spirit.

And, of course, his skills were not limited to defense.

“Now it’s my turn.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke with a grin, dropping his left hand from the sword and lowering his stance. In karate, this was known as the horse-stance . Then, he diverted the huge amount of energy generated in his left arm to his right fist. Furthermore, from his feet, which were in contact with the earth, he took in the energy of the earth’s flowing veins, accumulating the energy of the planet itself into his body.

This was the essence of the ‘Dragon {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Fist,’ the ‘Star-Body Assimilation.’ Of course, the physical burden was unimaginable, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was able to overcome it with his spirit. He thought only about winning, not about what would come after.

“Nuh?!” By the time Mujika could sense the danger, it was already too late.

“Draconic Blast!!”

This was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ultimate technique, the most powerful technique he could unleash, easily surpassing even the Draconic Cannon.

At first glance, it was just a straight fist thrust, exactly the same as the one that had smashed Insect General Saril’s body to pieces, but its power was beyond the laws and common sense of this world.

For Mujika, it was the same—he finally understood {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s abnormality after a gaping hole was made in the center of his chest through the shell armor, but it was already too late.

I’m not sure being vigilant would be enough…I must be going senile…

Mujika thought his final thoughts.

But for some reason, the defeat felt good.

Mujika died satisfied, not as an Insect General, but as a warrior.

Not bad, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s eyes widened.

He was already a very likable person, but his strength was worth admiring even from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s point of view. Simply watching the advanced offense and defense of an awakened master gave {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| the feeling that she had gained a great deal of experience.

But for now, the priority was to deal with the remaining problem, Peliod.

Now that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had defeated Mujika, it was time to launch an all-out battle. It would be nice if {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could join them, but she was not ready to move just yet.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ blow had been that deadly.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| felt frustrated at her inadequacy and analyzed the situation calmly.

Geez, these bugs are seriously troublesome…

Those were her true feelings and conclusion.

Just now, Peliod’s power had increased even further. While it was good that Mujika was defeated, Peliod had also been strengthened. The reason was that she had taken Mujika’s power.

The power of Zess had been directly taken by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Therefore, there was no collection for Peliod. However, once Mujika died on the battlefield, all of his power was absorbed into Peliod. By using that, Peliod could perform a Life Reconstruction on her own body as well. This was why Peliod’s power was so troublesome on the battlefield.

Peliod’s whole body was now covered with warrior-like armor, and in her hands was a sinister sword. Having taken Mujika’s characteristics and experience as her own, Peliod now appeared to be capable of fighting melee combat.

Her weaknesses seem to be disappearing more and more. When it comes to taking away the power of the fallen in this battlefield, I am very grateful for Milord’s policy of no casualties

The power of those who died on this battlefield, whether friend or foe, would flow into Peliod. The only way to break such a condition was to destroy the barriers that cover the battlefield.

But that was impossible.

This was because not only Insect Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the enemy leader, but even {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim was making efforts to maintain the barriers.

If they hadn’t, this planet itself would have disappeared long ago.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ goal was to dominate the planet, not to destroy it. However, as a result, Peliod’s unrivaled state was established. It was a very troublesome situation, but it was already too late to realize it now.

But well, it doesn’t seem like she’ll get any stronger…right? Don’t be too hasty. I just have to find a way to get to the bottom of this.

There were no insectar survivors other than the King and the Queen. Unless there were casualties from the allied camps, there was no doubt that she couldn’t be strengthened any further.

And naturally, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| correctly understood the situation as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did. At this rate, we will be defeated. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| felt a sense of crisis.

What she needed to think about now was how to attack Peliod before any of her friends were killed.

There was nothing decisive.

It was a miracle that the battle was even balanced, and such a tightrope situation could not last for long. Even a single mistake would lead to a defeat in the battle like a dam bursting from a single ant hole.

Before that happened, she had to do something.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s expression turned angry as she glared at her motionless right arm.

‹In that case, I will lend you my power.›

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| heard a voice that should not have been heard.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Milim were protecting this battlefield with their own ‘Defense Barriers.’

Shortly after this, an event occurred that forced {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to make a decision.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| heard the voice of someone who should not have been here and realized that this was no longer the time to spectate.

It was not possible, she thought, but she was not so foolish as to doubt the reality of the situation.

“Hey, did I fail to die?”

“Hmph, you’ve been summoned from the other world because I wasn’t good enough.”

The one smiling wryly was Lieutenant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was supposed to have died by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s hand.

Unknown to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s Ultimate Skill ‘King of Heroes’ had been activated just before this. In other words, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| here was a physical entity, though not a living one. He was as real as the real thing, and yet not the real thing, a “dead {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| (Einherjar )” that was of the same quality as a Digital Lifeform. It would have normally been impossible, but through {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ability, he had rushed to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in her perilous situation.

“Well then. I hope you’re not saying that this is the end for the devil who killed me.”

“That’s right, of course not. I was about to beat him to a pulp, but then you interrupted me.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, too, did not ask back with a “How?”

With a fearless smile, he nodded his head in an “In that case, good,” fashion.

“I will lend you my strength as well, so please forgive me.”

It was a very natural offer of cooperation.

And {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| accepted it as a matter of course.

“Well, why not? I’m like this too, so I’ll borrow it.”

She did not care about her pride as a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

No, rather, she seemed to be quite happy.

And thus, a powerful combination was born.

Even in this moment, the two were casually having a meeting.

“So, what’s the plan? Are you going to take him down?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| calmly made unreasonable demands as soon as he became an ally.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also taken aback, but then let out a sigh and began to explain.

“As good as I am, even I can’t beat that.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was realistic.

Even though he had only just appeared in this world, he remained calm and aware of the situation.

Based on this, he made a very rational decision.

“But right now, fortunately, his eyes are on other people.”

“Huh?”

“If you can’t win with a straightforward attack, just use subterfuge.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said that and then placed his hand on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| places his hand on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s shoulder: It’s high noon, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|." class="full"/>

To be more precise, he intended to put his power into the Golden Gun in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s hands.

“Suddenly holding hands is a little embarrassing, isn’t it?”

“Shut up. Now is not the time for jokes like that.”

Actually, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| meant what she said quite seriously. Nevertheless, she was coldly dismissed and felt quite offended.

However, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was correct.

It was indeed an important time to defeat the enemy in order to prevent any harm to her fellow comrades.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| focused her attention on what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was planning to do.

Then he noticed it.

“I see, it’s your ‘Judgment.”’

“That’s right. I put all my strength into this bullet. You just need to concentrate on controlling it.”

You know how to use it, don’t you? there was no need to ask such questions.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| trusted {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

She sensed this and was in a better mood.

“Yeah, leave it to me.”

And so, she agreed with a big smile on her face.

Peliod was the ruler of the battlefield.

Despite the twists and turns, things had generally gone according to plan.

What she didn’t like was that there were not as many deaths as expected.

Moreover, there were no casualties from the enemy forces.

Even if some of them were injured seriously enough to leave the battlefield, it appeared they were being given first aid with magic and recovery medicine, so none of them would die.

She had been planning to collect the power of the dead in this battlefield after going through great lengths to form a special barrier, but she was unable to achieve the expected results.

Well, even so, I was able to devour my children and integrate their powers. I suppose you could say that was a success.

In fact, Peliod’s current power was much stronger than it had been at the beginning of the battle. It was not simply the mere difference of energy values, but also the combination of the children’s skill-levels.

Adding the newly acquired melee combat ability to the ‘Spatial Domination’ that she had been so good at from the beginning, it was impossible for her to fall behind the small fry that clung to her. However, the small fry—{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Frey, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| \& Ranga—worked brilliantly together to minimize damage. Peliod was never fatally wounded, but when she tried to defeat them, it was surprisingly difficult.

This irritated Peliod.

This is not funny. Even with all the power I’ve gained, I am still unable to defeat these guys…

If she took her time, she would surely win. Despite this understanding, Peliod was unable to suppress her frustration.

One person in particular whom she did not like was the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| named {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. He should have died long ago.

Even though she had hit him directly multiple times with attacks that were intended to kill, he kept getting back up again and again.

Moreover, those eyes of his were detestable.

Even though he should have clearly understood the difference in their power, he was still staring at Peliod as if he would never give up. It was as if he was sure of his victory.

Just stop joking around already. That’s the kind of look I should be giving you guys!

The thing with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still understandable. That’s why she had {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| fire those two big shots in order to exhaust her. He was only as good as Mujika before the ‘Life Reconstruction,’ but his durability is abnormal. I wonder how long he can withstand my attacks…

This was why specialized types were so troublesome… Peliod kept her composure while trying her best to calm down her inner frustration. Then, as if to take out her anger, she swung her appendages to launch a ‘Dimensional Slash.’

However, most of the slashes were offset by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Chaos Eater,’ and the remaining slashes were also neatly avoided, only serving to increase Peliod’s anger.

This was not because Peliod was lacking in ability, but because {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were doing their best with their lives on the line.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had overcome his fear and devoted himself to troubling Peliod.

Trusting {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Ranga fully cooperated.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| enjoyed fighting, but he understood that if he died, it would be the end. He overcame those fears and was fighting purely to kill Peliod.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Frey were repeatedly attacking Peliod from the air and land, fully utilizing their awakened power. Indeed, their training in Ramiris’ labyrinth had paid off. Without that experience, they would have been forced to leave the front lines long ago due to a misallocation of forces.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and she read the situation very precisely to give the best instructions. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was safe because she had been accurately switching the role of the shields.

As for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, his consciousness was already hazy.

As Peliod had predicted, it was a miracle that he was still alive.

He remained standing with his spirit alone.

The ‘full body armor’ that had become one with his ability had cracked and shattered, leaving only remnants. And his body had long since exceeded their limits, so battered that even the ‘Ultraspeed Regeneration’ could not keep up.

The only reason why he was still able to fight was because of the secret of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s power.

His Ultimate Gift ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| King Beelzebub’ included the ‘Grant Protection’ ability, which increased the defense of his comrades, and the ‘Substitute’ ability, which took the damage taken by others. Moreover, by combining these two abilities, one could achieve a completely different effect. In other words, it had the effect of transferring the damage you received onto others. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was able to distribute his damage to his subordinates while adjusting the amount of damage he took.

But even that had limits.

His subordinates claimed to be able to endure more, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| knew this to be a lie.

Everyone had reached their limits, just as he had.

Still, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| stood.

He looked forward and did not look away from Peliod.

The one who looks away from the fight, loses. He was simply following {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words.

It was really a casual remark said at a drinking party, but to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, it was the best thing he had ever heard. However, even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had his limits.

“Muu…I can’t get up!”

“Ufufufufu, you finally sank,” Peliod laughed. “I’ll congratulate you for your good performance, so let’s kill you once and for all.”

It was not out of mercy that she left {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| on the back burner, but that she was going to slowly torture him later. The only concern was that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Peliod’s lord, had entered into battle with {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim, and the outcome of that battle was uncertain.

It was still as planned.

Peliod did not doubt {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’ victory, but she wanted to go to the aid of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as soon as possible to make sure of it.

It was because a chill ran down her spine.

She sensed the presence of someone or something interfering in this battlefield, within the very space that Peliod controlled.

It can’t be?! There are only a handful of people who can enter here.

Even among the powerful entities who were informed of the situation beforehand, it was difficult to enter this controlled space from the outside. Even if they interfered with space-time through offensive measures like Milim, it would have taken much more time after the anomaly was sensed in the ‘Barrier.’

And yet, this person appeared in this space as if there were no obstacles.

There shouldn’t have been anyone capable of such a thing.

If there were, it was something higher than a mundane life form.

Peliod located the coordinates of the person’s appearance and fixed her gaze upon it.

And there she saw a golden glow.

The glint was coming from the barrel of a gun, and the muzzle of that gun was pointed at Peliod herself. The person who was holding the gun was the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had been left alone, thinking that she could no longer do anything.

The target was close to the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, her eyes were sharply fixed on Peliod’s head.

It was clear what she was going to do.

And it was threatening enough to make Peliod shudder.

“Stoooop!!”

Faster than she could speak, a bullet shattered Peliod’s head.

And without exception, the very existence of her life was reaped.

Thus, Peliod was extinguished without even a moment to leave a word of farewell.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sensed that Peliod has disappeared.

Her existence was gone—in other words, she was dead.

It was a grave situation.

“It’s time,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| muttered to himself, deciding to withdraw.

“Hm?” Milim was suspicious.

“I told you that further fighting is pointless.”

Peliod’s death was unexpected for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. It was to the extent that future plans were thrown into chaos, and he could no longer be concerned with the immediate victory.

Even if he continued to fight Milim, it was 50-50 whether {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would win or not. The reason why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had still decided to fight was that Peliod was planning to kill all the enemy generals, collect their power, and use it to support {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

If Peliod herself could be ‘Life Reconstructed’ by integrating the power of the warriors here, she would be reborn as a super-enhanced being, though not as powerful as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

However, that plan had fallen through.

As it was, he found himself in a battle that he was not even sure he could win. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not optimistic enough to tolerate such uncertainty.

Besides, there was an even greater concern.

This battlefield was covered by a complex of ‘Barriers’ with the purpose of reducing the damage to the planet. Yet, the overall strength of the ‘Barrier’ had been weakened by the death of Peliod, who had been a part of it.

Just as Milim was holding back her power, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, too, had yet to show his full potential. He also judged that further continuation of the battle might cause unforeseen problems.

“Are you running away?”

“Ridiculous,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sneered at Milim’s provocation.

Milim was no fool, and she understood that she would not be able to give her best if the ‘Barrier’ was lost. It was true that Milim was hiding her power.

She did not use all the power she had in her body to the extent that, when using it, she even felt that defeating {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would not be difficult.

However, the problem was what would follow.

Once Milim’s power was released, it was difficult to stop it because after it exceeded the limit, Milim lost all reason and would enter a rampaging state.

Milim’s ‘Stampede,’ as Frey once told Clayman, really existed. Milim had told her so casually that Frey did not think it was real, but it was indeed a true story.

Milim thought to herself.

My friends are also exhausted and some of them are even in danger if they are not treated soon enough. It’s better to make a fresh start rather than to forcefully finish him off.

That was Milim’s conclusion.

Therefore, Milim decided to let {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| go.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| confirmed Peliod’s disappearance and smiled happily.

“{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, look at that. We won.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| turned around to say that, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was nowhere to be seen.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had not been formally summoned by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ability. It was an existence that made sense of an illusion created by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s desire.

“Heh, I understand. You came here because you were worried that I wasn’t good enough, right?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| spoke to the empty sky with a smile on her face. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was raising his battle cry of victory.

It was funny how surprisingly similar they were to each other.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| collapsed in exhaustion and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| helped him up as if to congratulate him on a good fight.

As {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others were carried away to Tempest, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| murmured with emotion.

“We won.”

“Ah, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-san.”

“{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, I feel embarrassed to be addressed with ‘-san’ by a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who has lived longer than myself.”

“Well, that’s all right. I, for one, pay respect to those whom I recognize.”

“I’m honored.”

The conversation stopped there, and the two basked in the afterglow of their victory for a few moments.

With so many wounded, it was hard to call it a complete victory. However, no one was killed. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was satisfied with that alone.

As far as this battlefield was concerned, she had given strict orders to her {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to recover the souls of the dead, so they were able to deal with this scale of damage. Even so, if it had been hit by a powerful wide-range attack like {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s devastating technique, the casualties would have been irreversible.

The fact that they could all rejoice together in this way was no doubt a great victory.

“I will get stronger.”

“Hm. The legendary {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| I was told about were portrayed as {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that didn’t understand the human mind… But when we’re actually talking to each other like this, I surprisingly find that we can get along.”

“It’s a bit late for that, isn’t it?” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| laughed at {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s frankness.

Seeing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| like that, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiled at her.

“If you are aiming for strength, then I won’t lose either. If my body is about to give out after just that amount of exertion, then I am still lacking in kung fu.”

“Ahaha. You’re pretty good at it, but you still intend to train even harder than that.”

“Isn’t it natural? I have to push my mind and body to the limit so that I can give it my all for a longer period of time. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-dono would be a good opponent for me, don’t you think?”

“That’s a good idea. I’ve been thinking of training more with the body that was entrusted to me by His Lordship. I’m willing to take you up on your offer.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| shook hands firmly.

Since they both had the same goal of aiming higher, there was no reason to refuse.

Milim joined the conversation in her usual manner.

“That’s not fair! That special training, I’m gonna join too!!”

Milim was very happy and nonchalant about the situation.

“Hey, hey, does Milim really need to get any stronger?”

“Mm. Milim-sama is the strongest, so she has no need for any special training, right?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was no slouch either, but there was always someone better. It was a well-known fact that Milim was out of the norm, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had come here and interacted with Milim, understood that fact to the point of disgust.

Even so, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still one of the better ones and could respond to most of the crazy requests with a smile, but that was not the case with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Unlike {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| tried to be very serious and reserved.

However, Milim did not get the message.

“Wahahaha! What are you saying? I won’t allow you to exclude me from the fun!”

And so, she forcefully decided to participate.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| read the situation correctly here.

He sensed the danger.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| saw Milim descending from the sky and had been secretly listening to her. He sensed something disturbing in the flow of the conversation.

If things went on like this, he would likely be forced to participate, so he decided to make a strategic retreat.

It was an excellent judgment of the situation.

“Well, I’m off to report my victory!”

And then, hopping onto Ranga, the two now split, he fled the scene like the wind.

The combination of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s constant attention to his surroundings, and his willingness to absorb any useful information, had saved his life.

Ranga trusted {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

His ability to foresee danger had helped him many times, so he followed {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s lead without any doubts. As a result, Ranga also succeeded in escaping.

As for the others…

“Nn? Uh, h-hey…”

“Hold on Milim, you can’t possibly be planning to drag me into this too, right?”

Not only {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who were the first to be caught, but also {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and Frey were forced to join against their will.

Thus, although the war in this region had caused a great deal of destruction, it had come to an end without any fatal damage—or so they thought.

“Blizzard, let all things be frozen over and put to sleep.”

As if aiming for the moment when everyone was caught off guard, the world was dyed white. A blizzard of despair swirled from the outer edges of the battlefield to the center, encircling everyone so that no one could escape.

“It can’t be, you—”

Milim was the first to notice, but by then it was already too late.

She was completely caught off guard.

There weren’t many people who could fool a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as ancient as Milim.

However, it was not an impossible feat for the eldest sister of the True Dragons, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Velzard.

“It’s been a long time, Milim.”

“What are you doing, Velzard?”

“{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, I came here to see my lovely niece. I need your help with something.”

“Don’t look down on me. If you’re going to ask me for a favor, you’d better behave appropriately. Get rid of that blizzard first and then I’ll talk to you about it!”

Milim intimidated Velzard while holding back her anger.

If things continued this way, her friends would be in danger.

In fact, those on the outer edge had already been frozen and turned into ice sculptures. They were not dead, but even their vital activities had ceased.

It might sound good to hear that they were in a state of suspended animation, but their lives could be destroyed by Velzard’s will alone.

Milim understood this.

She was caught completely off guard, aiming for the moment she relaxed right after the deadly battle with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Frey felt an even greater sense of danger than Milim.

If Milim were to become enraged and lose control, this entire area would be burnt to ashes. If that were to happen, the scale of the damage would be unimaginable, and it was uncertain how many people would survive.

I have to make a decision…

Frey decided that it would be dangerous for Milim to let Velzard do as she pleased.

Most likely, the longer she delayed, the worse the situation would become. Thinking as such, Frey transmitted an order to the Soaring Flock without Milim’s approval.

‹Take out Velzard!!›

With that voice as a signal, the Soaring Flock moved out at once.

There was no person who did not understand the terror of Velzard. Everyone was prepared to die in this suicide attack.

Milim, their beloved master, was kind to the point of fatality. The more people who fell asleep as ice sculptures, the more Milim’s patience would reach its limit.

Once that happened, there was no turning back.

Even now, she was forced to endure out of consideration for Frey and her other friends. If the situation worsened any further, she would have no choice but to follow Velzard’s lead for fear of sacrifices.

To Frey’s knowledge, the only time Milim had ever fought seriously was when she clashed with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and destroyed the country, long before Frey was born.

If Milim fought seriously with the intention of killing her opponent without regard to the cost to her allies, she would never have a hard time no matter who the opponent was. And yet, Milim never once fought seriously.

In other words, they were Milim’s shackles.

Because Milim was so kind, Frey acted so that they would not be a burden to her.

“Tch, we were late. You guys can run away if you want to, but if you’re going to stay, you’d better be prepared.”

“One crisis after another. Moreover, this time it’s with the aunt of our lord. I hate a battle that can’t be won, but if it’s for Milim-sama’s sake, I can’t complain about it.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| made his announcement, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| followed him with a laugh.

Of course, no one from the Winged Beast Knights left.

The warrior priests led by Hermes had also abandoned their roles as medics and switched to battle mode.

Thus, Milim’s subordinates rushed to Velzard all at once.

“Y-you guys, stop! Hurry and get the hell out of there!!”

As if to drown out Milim’s screams, a havoc of magic and spirit bullets were concentrated on Velzard.

“Milim-sama is loved. Me as well, I wish I could have served you earlier…” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| murmured.

She was exhausted from the battle with Peliod, and her energy was running low. Even so, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| stood up again and firmly fixed her gaze on Velzard.

Velzard was an absolute force to be reckoned with.

Frankly speaking, the probability of winning was zero.

Frey could not have been unaware of this, and if she had only wanted to survive, she would have ordered the army to “disperse and leave this place.”

The reason why she did not do so was probably because—

{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, she’s a cunning one, isn’t she? I didn’t dislike her in the first place, but her decisiveness is deserving of respect.

Frey’s aim was to get Milim to abandon her doubts.

If they were killed by Velzard, Milim would no longer have a reason to hesitate. Frey made the quick decision that if Milim survived, that was all that mattered.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| followed suit.

Their subordinates also made the choice to share their fate without any hesitation.

They all loved Milim.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was the same way, so she could understand their feelings. She respected those who had made the same decision as the subordinates she had lost, and she too was prepared to die here.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who remained in this land, was also thinking about what she should do in this situation.

An endurance match against the flawless Velzard was impossible.

Velzard was not as gentle as Velgrynd.

There was no way for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to win against Velzard, and whether or not she could escape from this place depended on her luck.

However, fleeing was not an option to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

It can’t be helped. If I’m not careful, I’ll be disobeying His Lordship’s orders, but I should probably go along with them here. Velzard-sama is lacking nothing as an opponent. Let’s do my best to struggle!

And so, she made a quick decision.

It was as good as a disaster for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s subordinates, but none of them could escape from this place anyway.

Victory over Velzard was the only way out.

However, everyone understood that this would never happen.

Therefore, the only thing {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others could do was to lead all the souls of the dead who would emerge from this place and keep them away from true death.

“Get fired up, guys. Make sure you don’t miss a single one.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s words were met with a collective nod of approval from her subordinates.

At this point, there was no more time for recovery. The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| gave up their incarnated bodies and returned to their original states as spiritual lifeforms.

Although their influence on the material world would be reduced, it was more rational for them to lead the dead.

Thus, in a very short time, everyone was ready.

But the next moment…

How foolish.

That cold and heartless intent reverberated throughout the minds of all those present on the battlefield.

It was a quiet voice that was drowned out by the blizzard, yet it carried a very loud wave of thought.

Perhaps in response to the voice, the blizzard turned into a raging blizzard, whiting out the battlefield.

It was unreasonable violence.

A supernatural disaster of such an unimaginable scale had appeared on the battlefield that the concept of resistance was laughable.

Now, go to sleep.

The pure white ice and snow raged on.

The soldiers were the first to be transformed into ice sculptures.

Then came the captains, and even the top brass.

Only a few were left. Those who had reached the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| level remained.

But it was only a matter of time…

Witnessing the hopelessness of the situation, Frey prepared for her own death.

The same went for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The only reason they were still standing was because Milim was protecting them.

If not for that, Frey and the others would have been overwhelmed by the energy that Velzard had unleashed long ago.

As proof of this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who was a little further away from Milim, was unable to even shed her body and was left immobile.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the pillar of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, was in that state. Her subordinates were no different.

And of course, Frey’s Soaring Flock, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s Winged Beast Knights, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s band of priests and priestesses had all been turned to ice sculptures.

Velzard had not even attacked them.

This blizzard was nothing more than a release of her {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. For those who understood it, this phenomenon was an overwhelming feeling of hopelessness.

Milim, who was protecting Frey and the others, was unable to move.

If Milim abandoned them, then their fate would be sealed.

Ahh, kind Milim. You truly are a sweetheart. I love you.

Frey thought so sincerely.

She suddenly felt eyes on her and turned her attention to see {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| smiling grinning fearlessly.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| let out a big sigh and nodded his head with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was praying silently.

I’m sorry, everyone, she seemed to be apologizing to someone.

It was the very image of those who had made up their minds.

‹I guess you’ve made up your minds.›

‹Yeah. Let’s do it with all at once, as flashy as possible.›

‹Mm. If we’re going to fall anyway, let’s give Milim-sama one last glimpse of our heroism.›

‹{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], false):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. Now I finally understand how my subordinates felt. So that’s it. They didn’t die in vain. In that case, I’ll have to bring them something to brag about, too.›

The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| under Milim were united in that moment. And…

“Wait, you guys?!”

They took action before Milim could stop them.

The coordination between the four of them was nothing short of brilliant.

As if they had been warriors for a thousand years, they approached Velzard with a series of unerring, instantaneous attacks.

But alas, all of that did nothing.

“I’m glad, really. Because you guys were as strong as I expected you to be, I was able to deal with you without any mishaps.”

Velzard smiled and remained standing there coldly.

In front of her, four new ice sculptures were born.

At the same time, Milim’s expression froze.

It was an expression in which all the other emotions had fallen away, leaving only one.

In other words, a look of rage.

Milim was furious that her friends were taken away from her.

“I won’t forgive you. Taking away my friends? I will never forgive you!!”

Milim’s cry pierced the battlefield.

At the same time, Milim’s Skill, the Ultimate Skill ‘Wrath King Satanael,’ began to operate at full power. Taking in the surrounding magicules and pouring in all of her own mana, it continued to generate even greater power.

Fueled by rage and the magicules emanating from Milim, it was the ultimate power to propagate magicules. The ‘magicule breeder reactor’ was so powerful that it could not be mastered, and was the essence of the Ultimate Skill ‘Wrath King Satanael.’

The magicules that were used as fuel were returned as more power.

They were literally breeding.

As long as this was activated, the amount of magicules in Milim would continue to increase rapidly. Moreover, no matter how much she consumed, they would never decrease, which was the ultimate power.

Veldanava’s offspring, the title of the Dragon Princess was not an exaggeration.

The sole individual who wielded infinite power—that was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim.

And again, Milim roared loudly.

At that moment, the heavens trembled and the earth shattered.

The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| armor enveloping Milim’s body changed ominously, as if responding to her passion. It was not a measure to protect Milim from external enemies, but rather a measure to prevent her from being defeated by her own internal power.

The overflowing torrent of power fused with the armor, transformed it, and covered Milim’s entire body. Milim’s transformation was complete.

Upon her back were a pair of jet-black wings. A single red horn sprouted from her forehead, shining in iridescent colors. The rest of her bare skin was covered with hard, shining dragon scales with mysterious patterns and dull, shifting colors.

This was Milim’s true form.

This was the true form of the Dragon Princess, who, despite her human body, possessed a power that surpassed even that of the True Dragons and manifested as the embodiment of absolute destruction.

“Ara ara, this is the second time I’ve seen you like this. Since we’re already here, why don’t I play with you a little?”

“Die.”

There was no one left to stop Milim.

Heaven and earth rumbled with the fury of the ancient {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Immediately thereafter…

The world would once again be exposed to the wrath of the ultimate dragon {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Chapter 2

Report and Countermeasures

“Has Velzard moved?”

Vega, who was staring at the video with a pallid expression, nodded to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Tch, both {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| are even more powerful than I imagined… Shit, they’re powerful as hell. Looking at that and smiling calmly, after all, the current me doesn’t even come close to that Velzard woman…”

Even Vega seemed to have realized the reality after watching Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| fight. No matter how confident Vega was, he could at least understand the difference with Milim and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

“Don’t be so upset. I, too, had my own considerations when I heard that our long-time enemies, the insectars, had been destroyed.”

Zalario, who had just been recalled, spoke up in this way.

Milim’s forces had won a victory against the powerful enemy that had tormented them so much. Moreover, despite the heavy damage, there were no casualties among Milim’s forces.

It could be said that it was due to a difference in conditions and strategy, but Zalario was at fault when he could not prepare for it. In any case, it was no excuse, and the reality was that Milim’s team was better than Zalario’s team.

It was no wonder Zalario was not amused.

“So, what are you going to do, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|?”

That remark was a question about Velzard’s actions. She seemed to be planning something, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| left it alone.

Zalario believed that the rapidly changing situation had deviated from the original plan, and he wanted to say that it was time to correct the course.

And there was one more person who was indignant.

“That’s right. If you hadn’t interfered with me, I would have defeated that divine enemy by now! Just what is your plan? Let’s hear your explanation right now!!”

Upon returning to the Heavenly Star Palace, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| ordered Mai to visualize the war situation in various parts of the world. Then, he ordered Zalario to bring back Jahil, who had been launching a diversionary tactic against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s camp.

Jahil’s behavior was also too flashy to be called a diversion.

Zalario was right to stop him, but Jahil, who had been stopped, did not seem to be amused. He was questioning {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as if planning to attack him.

“Hmph, don’t be so hasty. You couldn’t have taken down {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| by yourself anyway.”

“What, are you mocking me?”

“That’s not the case. I’m just trying to proceed cautiously. Look, with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| joining our ranks, the balance of power is now greatly in our favor. With Fenn as a Three Star Commander, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is nothing but a distant memory.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| told Jahil this to appease his anger. However, Jahil’s dissatisfaction did not go away.

“Certainly, I acknowledge Fenn’s power. But {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, the enemy of the Divine Ancestor, must be dealt with by my own hands!”

In a sense, Jahil’s dissatisfaction was a grudge born of anger. Whether or not the takeover of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had anything to do with it was not clear, but his heart was boiling over with raging anger.

That is why he attacked {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in a somewhat out-of-control manner. When he was stopped, Jahil was so furious at himself why he was hindered.

But the next moment…

“Do you not hear me?”

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s one question, quietly uttered.

It was not particularly intimidating, and it was uttered in a normal way. And yet, the air of authority that overpowered the statement caused even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others who were not participating in the conversation to become tense.

“N-no, it was my fault.”

Jahil regained his composure and immediately apologized. It was a very wise decision.

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, your dominance is poisonous to those who are not used to it. Please remember that now that you are in your true form, you are nothing compared to what you used to be.”

With Zalario defending Jahil, the situation was finally settled.

And so the story goes back to the beginning.

Currently, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had three strategic goals.

  • Get the Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Sariel’ from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had decided to rethink his objectives.

First, he had to collect the skills.

Since he had inherited {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s powers, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was now able to identify the angelic Ultimate Skills, however…

All-powerful—in other words, the return of the omniscient and omnipotent Creator.

The theory seemed logical, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was skeptical.

The reason was that Veldanava was not omniscient and omnipotent.

But, then again, it was Veldanava himself who had given the humans their desires. The result of this was a cycle of cause and effect, and it was only self-inflicted.

That is why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not doubt that Veldanava was no longer omniscient and omnipotent.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was convinced of this, and a cold smile appeared on his beautiful face.

This pastry was like a financier. It had a subtle savory accent and was seriously delicious.

S-so that’s it…

That’s why {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been talking about poison testing just now.

Then {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| let out a “hmph!” and turned her head away from me, her cheeks lightly flushed with embarrassment.
