Veldora asked a question.

But no one answered.

“Getting caught up in a battle like that means being reduced to ashes no matter where you are,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| muttered, looking pallid.

“Perhaps that is what {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| is trying to do.”

In old {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Velzard’s snowstorm had encased everything in ice. As a result, fortunately or unfortunately, the damage itself had been minimized.

It would be meaningless if Velzard did not lift the ice, but still, hope remained because it had not been completely lost.

However, that was not necessarily the case from here on out.

Any city would be vaporized in an instant by a direct hit from Milim, who had lost all rationality…

And it was not only {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that was in danger.

“Is he planning to let the world perish at Milim-sama’s hands?”

“I can’t say for certain, but he is crazy, so it is a possibility.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| calmly answered {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s question.

If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s intention was truly to spread death and destruction, it could be possible that he was trying to summon Ivarage by using this as a trigger.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| pointed out this possibility.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| also thought it was possible.

If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was calling him crazy, he must be that much more dangerous. With that kind of a person, there was no way to tell what he was thinking.

Either way, at this rate, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would disappear.

Where would they target after that?

The Western Nations, or was it the Golden Land El Dorado?

There was also the possibility that they would pass through all the cities and head straight for the labyrinth.

They did not have enough information.

In other words, no matter how much he thought about it, there was no answer to the question.

“This is not the time for idle chatter,” {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said and stood up.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was also there. If {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s assumption was correct, he was probably trying desperately to stop it by now. In that case, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| should be taking action instead of worrying about it.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not averse to going with his gut. He had an overconfident side that often gave him the belief that he could do things as long as he tried. However, this was only for himself, and it went against his principles to involve others with it.

“Sorry, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.”

“Don’t worry about it.”

That conversation was enough.

With that alone, their minds were prepared to march out to the frontlines of death when—

“I’ll go too.”

{:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Leon, who had slipped out of the sickroom and had been there for some time, announced that he was going to join the battle.

And furthermore…

“I will accompany you. I have an unspeakable grudge against Jahil.”

Even {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had come to the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, a determined expression on her face.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was right behind her.

“I have to beat up that son of a bitch and free {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|! I’ll do my best!!” she declared with tears in her eyes.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had no reason to refuse.

“I will not hesitate. I gratefully accept your offer.”

Thus, the participants had been decided.

With this, the missing piece was now in place.

Even after {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others had left, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still in a flurry of activity.

Information was being gathered from all over the world and delivered to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

I don’t want anything more to happen. This was the common wish of all the busy workers. They were all praying for everyone’s safe return.

However, even such a modest hope was then shattered.

“An urgent message from {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama!! He says that they have come into contact with the Titan army at the Long Wall in the desert!!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s prediction had come true in the worst possible way.

Without mercy, the great battle had begun.

Chapter 3

Quake of the Titans

At the border between the Barren Lands and the Western Nations, there was a long structure called the Long Wall.

It was said to have been built by the work of the god {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in order to protect civilization from the hot sands known as the Desert of Death.

This Long Wall was considered sacred because it was protected by a special barrier. That is, the magicule repellent barrier.

As the name suggested, its purpose was to prevent the intrusion of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

It was common knowledge for those who lived in the frontier that this barrier was a zone of protection for human existence. The barrier was activated to protect the Long Wall, preventing the invasion of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| coming from the Desert of Death.

The principle was simple: by inhibiting the accumulation of magicules, its purpose was to prevent giant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| from appearing. At the same time, it had the property of repelling magicules, so that more powerful {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would not be attracted to it.

Of course, this was not a universal solution, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sometimes invaded through the frayed edges of the barriers. However, since there were desert people who hunted {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| for a living, this had never been a major problem.

This Long Wall was considered to be the front line of the battle against {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and was included in the patrol routes of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

Through these regular patrols, the cracks in the barriers have been found and repaired. That work also included defeating invading {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, thus protecting the lives of the people on the frontier.

These facts have been accumulated, and the belief in the god {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was thus enhanced.

At the same time, the myth of the safety of the Long Wall was firmly unshakable.

However, today…

After 2,000 years, the Long Wall would be revealed in its true form.

At the top of the Long Wall, there was a skeleton wearing sacred vestments.

It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

A few moments ago, a distortion of space had been detected. Immediately after that, a large-scale teleportation revealed an army of giants.

“Oh, just as my god predicted, the enemy has teleported.”

Far from being flustered, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was murmuring happily.

He was more excited than threatened by the fact that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s prediction had come true.

Still, he did not forget his duty in his excitement. He finished the ‘Telepathy Net’ to his home country and then switched his attention to the battle in earnest.

On the other hand, the giants who had transferred to the new location were convinced that their surprise attack had succeeded. They believed that the enemy would be in a panic since they had all moved several days’ worth of travel with Mai’s ability.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s group had deliberately shown their march to catch {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| off guard. The enemy must have seen this and taken countermeasures, predicting that they would not be fully prepared to intercept them.

But in fact, that was not the case.

As of yesterday, it was not something to be panicked about, and a defensive posture had been constructed to be able to respond to the situation without sleep or rest.

The majesty of the Chained Titan Army was still clear even though they were far away.

More than their numbers, their quality was overwhelming.

Each of them was a huge mass of muscles.

Various kinds of giants such as giant {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s, cyclops, and multi-armed giants (hecatoncheires ) were approaching them in packs.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| laughed at the sight of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s army as they emerged.

“Well, what a spectacular sight. This might be a bit of a challenge for my little skeletons.”

“A bit, huh?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was answered by a beautiful purple-haired woman standing next to him. It was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, looking great in her suit.

“To tell you the truth, it will be a little…it will be difficult, but we’ll make it work.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| hated to lose, so he never complained before battle. It was even or so because his army was immortal and could easily be revived.

“Hoh…what’s your plan?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| questioned the reason for {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s confident attitude.

“Hm, I can’t say that it’s much of a plan, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s command is quite good. Moreover, please take a closer look. Behold the line-up of my army!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said as such and then pointed to his subordinates—the Immortal Legion was all lined up in order.

“How is it? The equipment bestowed by my god has even reached the Bone Soldiers!!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| understood after being told. In short, this guy just wanted to show off.

………

……

…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was leading the immortal {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| he had summoned himself.

It was a spectacular sight to see such immortal {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| perfectly lined up inside the Long Wall.

The main force was led by two thousand death knights.

The death knights, led by the death lord, were the immortal knights who rode on death horses. They were equipped with full-body magisteel chainmail armor, magimail, that gave off a faint glow. Needless to say, it was the best quality armor of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| factory made in Tempest.

Although not produced by Garm himself, it was a high-class product made by his disciples, who lavishly used high-purity magisteel. The performance was guaranteed, and the product blended well with the mana of the death knights.

Since their defensive and offensive capabilities had been dramatically improved, they were more dangerous than their original A-minus rank. Now, they were as close to A rank as possible and had become strong enough to live up to their name as a main force.

And that’s not all.

In addition to the main force, there were other hidden gems.

Deployed on the Long Wall were lower-ranking {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| that lacked direct offensive power.

The total number of them was 50,000.

  • 10,000 Zombie Soldiers.

  • 20,000 Bone Soldiers.

  • 10,000 Bone Archers.

  • 10,000 Bone Knights.

Looking only at the numbers, it was an overwhelming fighting force.

Of course, they were weak individuals with an average strength of about D rank, so they would be of little use even if they were operated as they were. However, what was noteworthy here was the equipment of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was proud of it; the latest weapons, which were manufactured at full capacity in the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nation factories, were being used generously in battle.

The armor was standardized, so although the colors differed according to ranks, the uniforms of Tempest were identical in performance. The uniforms had a reasonable level of protection, and were even provided with fire-resistance, cold-resistance, and so on.

The most notable feature of the Bone Archers were the portable recoilless missile launchers on their backs. The missile projectiles, which were launched at five times the speed of sound, contained not only explosives, but also compressed magicules.

The Bone Archers were carried by Bone Soldiers, who were trained to support each Bone Archer with two Bone Soldiers. Thus, as many as 10,000 mobile artillery batteries were born.

However, the number of bullets was somewhat middling. The total number of rounds was 50,000, including one round loaded from the beginning and two rounds carried by each soldier.

Next, the Zombie Soldiers were all carrying automatic rifles. Although those were gunpowder weapons with no magicules, their destructive power was not to be underestimated. They would not be effective against enemies with physical resistance, but they were expected to have good results against lower-ranked giants.

Although the manufacturing method had been researched and established, the production of these firearms had been prohibited upon {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s decision. However, only this time, the experimental operation had been permitted under the condition that the serial number and the tracking magic were stamped on them.

Or rather, the documents had come to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| in the middle of a busy day, and he had stamped his seal without checking it carefully, so only {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was aware. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| himself was unaware of such a situation, but it was probably lucky that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| did not know about it.

And this was not the only secret weapon.

Finally, there was the equipment of the Bone Knights.

Amazingly enough, they were all equipped with {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s. They even had {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s hanging from their waists.

Equipped with armaments salvaged from the imperial soldiers, the sabers had greatly increased their offensive power while ignoring their defensive power.

It was extreme, but {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| decided that if he could incorporate suicide attack tactics into his immortal soldiers who did not fear death, then actual ability would be irrelevant.

This was the essence of the Immortal Legion.

An army of immortals, who did not require food or sleep, was assigned as the first force to intercept.

To make things even more troubling, these immortals all had their abilities increased under {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s control. In addition, the ‘Holy-Demonic Reversal’ ability of the Ultimate Gift ‘Necronomicon’ changed their attributes, so they were no longer affected by the magicule repellent barrier that stretched along the Long Wall, and they could work in the daytime without any problems.

Unlike in the labyrinth, the dead could not be resurrected once destroyed…but because holy magic would not work, it was advantageous that they would not be purified by means such as ‘Purification of the Dead: Turn Undead.’

Only those who had fought against them could understand just how terrifying the undead were now that they had become holy beings. Since they could not be killed by conventional attacks, the only way to stop them was to destroy them.

Now that very Immortal Legion had been deployed to intercept the enemy by making good use of the Long Wall.

The Long Wall was arranged in such a way that one could see everything in a panoramic view from the top, which was more than five meters high, making it easy for snipers to shoot at the enemy.

In fact, the original function of the Long Wall that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had built was precisely to serve as a defensive facility to thwart {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s territorial ambitions. The appearance of such weapons was unforeseen, and the vampires were initially supposed to intercept them with their magic, but since they were able to secure the advantage in this way, the details were not important.

………

……

…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s eyes narrowed at the sight of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s prided subordinates.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had honestly thought that it would be meaningless to have as many skeletons as possible.

However, she changed her mind the moment she saw the equipment.

No, what she was more concerned about was:

“Hey, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|…I want to ask, how did you get all of that equipment?”

The equipment for subordinates was provided by their superiors. That was the common understanding among the corps commanders and executives.

Of course, if you applied for and received permission, your equipment would be distributed to you. However, that was a waiting list, and no one, not even the leaders, was allowed to skip out on that process.

In the workshop of Tempest, the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| led by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was given priority. Since this was directly related to national defense, no one had complained about it.

Although all of them had been equipped recently, the large number of equipment made it difficult to do maintenance. Since they were made of magical steel, most of them could self-repair, but it was still true that most of the equipment reservations were filled by the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|.

The next spot was for commercial use for adventurers.

Since the purpose of this business was a national policy to earn foreign currency, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| could not interfere.

Therefore, waiting for free equipment took too much time.

In the midst of all this, there were many roughnecks enrolled in the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| who spent every day in training.

That in itself was commendable, but it was not productive.

Some people might think that this was not a problem as they were professional soldiers, but since they often broke their equipment or tore their uniforms, they often used the repair workshop with a consistent frequency.

Of course, free of charge.

Therefore, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had received many complaints.

Under such circumstances, it was impossible to apply for new equipment, and the official equipment of the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still in its initial state.

Even then, they were given only to the executives and early members, and not to the newcomers who had recently joined the group.

For those newcomers, apprentice craftsmen had given them the equipment they had made for practice, and they had equipped them diligently…but the appearance was not consistent, and bandanas and armbands had to be used to emphasize the purple color to somehow keep up appearances.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who had no choice but to ask {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| for new equipment again, was filled with a sense of wonder as to how {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, a newcomer to the group, was getting new equipment.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| answered this question with a smile.

“Well, it’s a simple story. I have been stealing cheap equipment worn by adventurers, crushing them, and using the money I get from them to buy iron ore directly. I also have contacts with merchants, so I make use of them as well.”

“No, wait. Do challengers even come to the floor that you’re guarding?”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was right to be skeptical.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s guardianship zone was from floors 61 to 70, meaning that something was being done behind the scenes.

“Hahaha! As for that, I had my men sent on missions to the location. It’s also good for training, so it kills two birds with one stone.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had been dispatching his subordinate {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| to the upper floors to make a lot of money. In the spirit of the “it’s all good as long as you don’t get caught” mentality, a rather absurd practice had gone unchecked.

“Yes, yes, I was very pleased to see that so many of the imperial soldiers had good equipment. But even so, the most rewarding thing was the defeat of the iron golem.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was convinced by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s cheerful voice.

Not only was he playing with adventurers in the labyrinth, but he had also been diligently collecting materials.

The terrain of the 51st to 60th floors was rocky and sometimes golem {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| appeared. Among them, iron golems were rich in high-quality iron. If such {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were defeated and stored in the labyrinth, high-quality magical steel would be produced before long.

Defeating iron golems was not only a good way to train for combat, but also to collect materials. It killed two birds with one stone, and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| couldn’t help but groan when she caught a glimpse of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s abundant financial resources. Or rather…

Huh? Could it be that this guy is making more money than me?! {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| suddenly realized.

There was a possibility that the other Guardians were also participating in other financial schemes.

On the flip side, was {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| herself. Originally, she had no attachment to money. In her home village of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|s, the blood and knowledge of otherworlders was inherited. Therefore, she understood the concept of economics itself, but…

In the first place, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was indifferent to things like money. It was only recently that she began paying attention to such things.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| asked the question straightforwardly, feeling that she should have asked earlier.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| nodded her head, though she didn’t get much information.

“Come, all those who suffer from eternal hunger! Devour all with your fangs!!”

‘Nihilistic Parade,’ dark magic of the most vicious caliber.

It was well-known that the most powerful holy magic was ‘Disintegration,’ the ultimate destruction magic against people and objects. It was also famous for the fact that only a few people could use it, but its high power was guaranteed. It was said that no one could survive a direct hit.

However, there were a few drawbacks.

The most notable of them was the narrow range of influence.

Even if it was the most powerful anti-personnel magic, it could not be used against entire armies. That is the kind of magic it was.

This was the dark magic ‘Nihilistic Banish,’ which {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and others excelled at.

He exerted all his mana into ‘Nihilistic Banish’ and completed it as ‘Nihilistic Parade,’ the magic of wide-area extermination.

Just as the magician intended, an extremely large magic circle appeared on the ground and in the sky.

Then, as if connecting heaven and earth, a dark electrical discharge commenced—countless numbers of dark spots were released. They were the fangs of darkness that devoured all matter.

It was the forbidden dark magic art, the manipulation of the forbidden void.

The void unleashed in this world would not disappear until its negative energy was brought to zero. It filled the inside of the magic circle barrier that connected heaven and earth, causing it to disappear.

It was one of the ultimate magics that could destroy the world if wielded incorrectly.

“Wahahahah! What do you think? Isn’t it amazing?!”

He seemed so innocent and overjoyed.

“You idiooot!! What are you thinking?! What would you have done if this dangerous magic failed and went out of control?!”

With the Ultimate Gift ‘Necronomicon,’ he understood the danger of ‘Nihilistic Parade,’ and his face was pale as he shouted.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, however, did not take offense and replied without hesitation.

“Because I want to show off, too!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was deflated after hearing this.

“No, I don’t think that’s…”

Throwing away all dignity, he had intentionally spoken his true feelings. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was taken aback by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s childish comment.

Therefore, on the contrary, he opened up and spoke frankly.

“W-well, it’s fine. We have succeeded!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| made an irresponsible remark that things would be fine as long as they were together.

Even if he was rotten, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, who showed no sign of remorse, would still be an insane genius.

It was useless to say anything anyway, and in fact, there was no problem since he had succeeded.

The enemy forces had been greatly reduced in number by the two extreme magics, and they were on the brink of destruction. Their numbers were already less than half of what they had been at the beginning, and in a normal war, they would have given up and retreated long ago.

Although the visibility was poor due to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Nihilistic Parade,’ they seemed to be on the verge of successfully defeating the enemy.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and his team, who hoped that the war would end in this way, looked upon the situation below with bated breath.

Sure enough, the result was…

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| recognized the danger of the magic at first glance.

He had been planning to overrun the city as soon as the war started, but the small fry stopped him in his tracks. And just when he thought they had reached a stalemate, his troops were reduced by more than 50 percent with that extreme magic.

This was a miscalculation on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s part, but it was not a great loss for him.

Although it was kept secret from the public, magic could not defeat the giants. A person who died by this means was not only out of luck, but also out of ability.

He could overlook the falling meteorites with a smile.

In fact, he praised it as splendid magic, and even thought of using it to determine who would be qualified to participate in this battle.

If it had been an attack such as dropping a huge rock stored in a different space from the sky, he would have judged that it was too destructive to ignore because of the positional energy added to its mass. However, since ‘Tempest Meteor’ was an attack of magically created meteorites, the power of giants could counter it without any problems.

A warrior should not be late in using magic intended to be used against a group.

In fact, none of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s core members nor his main warriors were lacking or even stopped.

That was the correct thing to do.

However, the magic invoked by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was no good.

This was because ‘Nihilistic Parade’ penetrated and damaged even the absolute power of ‘Magic Nullification’ possessed by True Giants.

The anti-magic guard ‘Magic Nullification’ automatically neutralized all kinds of magic attacks. Because of this ability, magic could not normally defeat giants. {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was a giant that could be called a mass of energy. Well, that’s just the way things were.

Two hours had passed since the battle began.

The battle had shifted to the next stage, a clash between the main battle forces.

Although the Chained Titan Army appeared to have greatly reduced its numbers from 30,000, the actual attrition rate was less than 10 percent. Now, they had formed an assault formation with their elite at the top and were clashing with the main forces of the Immortal Legion.

The formation was a crane-wing formation with 2,000 death knights in the center and 10,000 Bone Soldiers with secret weapons on both flanks. They were trying to surround the advancing Chained Titan Army but were outnumbered and could not enclose them.

The key to this strategy was to play towards the strengths of immortality, that being a suicidal attack strategy to strike and eliminate lured giants in order to reduce their numbers.

Nevertheless, there were limits.

At first glance, the battlefield appeared to be in a stalemate, but the momentum was tilted in favor of the titan forces.

The Bone Soldiers launched suicide attacks, triggering the mana that filled the battlefield. The death knights finished off the wounded and fallen giants, but unless it was a sure fatal blow, the giants would revive.

The problem here was the giants’ enormous stature.

The giants boasted huge bodies of 3 to 5 meters, and their muscular armor was so thick that it was difficult to deal a fatal blow to them. If too much time was taken, they would be crushed.

At first, things were going well, but as time went by, countermeasures were put in place.

Those with long weapons were being kept in check, and they could no longer approach carelessly. If they tried too hard, they would only be crushed like pieces of wood, and once that happened, the Bone Soldiers, who were inferior in strength, had become useless.

The death knights were also outnumbered and forced to fight hard, and their numbers gradually dwindled.

At this point, tensions were running through the Bloody Knights led by Louis, who was thinking that it was about their turn.

The effect of this magic, which had a special effect over a wide area, was astonishing.

Within its sphere of influence, it transformed the dead who died on the battlefield, regardless of whether they were friend or foe, into undead soldiers who were loyal to his orders.

This was the forbidden secret of necromancy.

It was the culmination of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s research.

The magic weapons made of magical steel worn by the death knights covered the huge bodies of up to four meters in height. Because this was an amalgamation of the grudges of the deceased, it was no wonder that the armor had been transformed according to the will of the owner.

The giants, who had been dominating with their power, had lost their advantage due to the emergence of a greater power.

The report of nearly 1,000 high-ranking fighters was false, and in fact, there were more than 2,000 elite fighters in their ranks.

He spoke with serious regret.

………

……

…

Louis remembered the old days.

In those days, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were famous.

Both of them were qualified to be heroes.

However, neither of them possessed a hero’s egg.

Still, they had naturally reached the level of sages, and if nothing had happened to them, they would have reached the level of saints.

But both of them were simply much too talented.

That is why the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| were jealous of them and had pushed them into a trap.

The {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| feared that if those two continued to grow, they would become a threat to their own positions, and so they took measures to keep {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others in the dark.

As he recalled, it was the cleansing of the large-scale dead spirit disaster. But in reality, this turned out to be a battle with a zombie dragon prepared by the {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, and the two sides were killed by each other.

They had gladly accepted the request and went to the Great Jura Forest. But since they did not return to the holy city, they were presumed dead.

Not even {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, Louis’ master, could have expected that they would fall into the hands of {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| after their death, nor that they would fall into the service of {:this.app.capitalCase(this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term], true):}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| after that through some strange fate.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, on the other hand, was crossing swords equally regardless of the height difference.

This literally meant that anyone who crossed swords with Glassord was destined to be defeated unilaterally by having their weapons and armor destroyed.

Gleipnir.

Since mythological times, these chains have been used to keep the rampaging evil gods at bay.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| saw through Fenn’s thinking and thought that it was just as well.

The difference in their strength had been too great. Fenn did not care about him.

This time, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was thinking that she was on the side of the underdog, and that’s all there was to it. Even so, she had no intention to give up easily.

As {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| loved fights, she would try to win until the very end, even if she lost.

As long as you keep trying, you will eventually win someday. In that case, there’s only one thing to do.

She was very much at ease with this idea.

“Allow me to introduce myself. I am Pain Lord {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|. What about you, Brawler-kun ?”

“{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, is it over now? Then I guess it’s my turn next.”

That’s right.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s declaration signaled the beginning of the time of despair.

The area around them was wide open in a circle, as if nobody else could be caught in the middle of it.

Hm, as expected of him.

In a momentary battle of swords, the one whose mind was disturbed first would lose. Deceiving the enemy with words was simply another fine tactic.

Then, as if moving on, Glassord continued his words.

“Nevertheless, why do you follow such a man?”

“If you have built up that much strength, there is no need to follow a weak immortal skeleton king. It is true that his necromancy is superior, but the true strength of a warrior is in his own body.”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was not pleased to see a true warrior go to such lengths. And yet, his expression did not change at all.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| replied gently to {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s panicked voice, “Even in the worst-case scenario, we can ask our god {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|-sama to prepare a new body for us!!”

The threat level remained the same even if the amount of energy required to kill the enemy was exceeded. Fenn’s attack was more powerful than Zegion’s, but it was no different from Zegion’s in the sense that it would kill you anyway.

Should she continue to fight toward defeat, or should she run away from the battle and work to make a comeback?

A wise person would not have had to choose.

Yes, certainly the old {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would have retreated without hesitation.

There was no point in fighting a battle that could not be won.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was at a loss.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| power—with the Ultimate Skill ‘{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| Asmodeus,’ she could control Life and Death. It was an alluring smile, not matching the appearance of a beautiful young girl.

Gunther was deeply convinced and remembered.

That’s right, a long time ago, when burying the Divine Ancestor, she had smiled just like this.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had always clung to life, but this was to keep her promise to her friends.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Magic Nullification’ was versatile, but it was not without its weaknesses. While it was able to cancel out all magic affecting the user, it could not negate all the magic effects on other people’s bodies.

Body reinforcement magic was a good example. In other words, defense barriers and body hardening could be ignored, but already reinforced speed and so on remained unchanged.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s ‘Tempest Meteor’ was an example. The summoned meteorite was erased because it was imaginary matter, but if it had been a real substance, it would have caused a certain amount of damage.

Suppose that a rock of a certain mass was stored in a different space, and then it was dropped with a flight magic spell. It would be impossible to cancel the positional energy given to the rock. In other words, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s reasoning was that indirect magic could not be canceled.

And he was right.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| had applied reinforcement magic to his body to fight skillfully. It worked.

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| said this as a final gesture and clenched his fists.

“No, stop!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| sensed the change in {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and realized that {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was in danger.

“Wha—”

Seeing this, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| realized just how much she had been taken care of by {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| until now,

And yet, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| was still standing here.

Just what kind of {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| would she be if she had abandoned her friend {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|, {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| thought.

It’s strange. I haven’t known {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| as long as I’ve known Chloe…

She didn’t want to fail {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| and the others, and that was why she was still standing here now.

That {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| must also have a lot of difficulties. He has always worked harder than possible to live up to the expectations of his colleagues.

That, or—

It’s just my imagination. It is impossible for me to expect anything from him!

Contrary to such thoughts, a smile naturally appeared on {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}|’s lips.

“Hmph, if I had such a thing, I would have used it long ago!”

{:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| puffed out her chest with pride.

At least until the very end, she would defend her pride as a {:this.app.allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]:}|{allTermsChosen[this.parentNode.dataset.term]}| by challenging the strong and never running away.
